text: Very friendly n the food is pretty good! I use to work near by so my coworker n I hit this place up ordered a gyro n some fries n it was pretty filling. Very tasty plus for the owner being so sweet!!
This place is the bomb. A+ service family owned couldn't ask for better food ! The lamb is very fresh and establishment is clean . I really like the food here

Baladie Cafe is exactly the kind of restaurant I use Yelp for. A locally owned place most would pass right over, but for the massive number of positive reviews. I was not disappointed by the food. One caveat before my review; I am not knowledgeable about Mediterranean food, so my review is based solely on taste, and nothing on authenticity.

You can get pita wraps, kabobs, spanakopita, moussaka, and platters with a mix of food. Wanting to try a bit of everything, I went with the Greek Sampler. It came with:
1) Half Greek salad - good flavor on the dressing, but don't expect many toppings.
2) Spanakopita - Savory pastry with spinach, quite good
3) Moussaka - An eggplant dish, I don't like eggplant but the meat & potatoes were flavorful
4) Pita, Gyro meat, Tzatziki sauce - Best Gyro meat I've had, nice taste on the sauce
5) Dolmas (2) - Rice & flavoring wrapped in Grape leaves - Soft rice, nice taste

The highlight of the night had to be the pistachio baklava. Not too sweet, and not too dry. I ordered 2, and almost went back for more they were so good. I'm trying to decide how often I can go back before it gets to be weird.

Once you've been once, you can call ahead for your order, but they have very quick service even when you walk in. I will definitely be going back soon to try something else.

This is a small family owned greek restaurant. Decent prices and great food!  The owners are really friendly and nice.  I had the lamb and beef gyros with the herb fries. I also had gotten the chicken gyro! The best gyros I've ever had! I would go out of my way just to eat here. I can't wait to taste the other items on their menu! Definitely be back!

Haven't been here in 6 months! I've been craving their food! Simply from their seasoned herb fries to their lamb & beef gyro. The seasoned fries are so tasty especially when dipped in their secret sauce, a small order just isn't enough! Guess what, hey now serve a family size basket!

This place was recommended by a close friend. I was not impressed at all. Service was below average, after taking our order the lady disappeared. It took 34 min to get our food and we were the only people in the whole place. There were dirty tables when we walked in and 45 min later when we left there were still the same dirty tables. 
On to the food.... for such a long wait the food came out fresh BUT I was given something I didn't order. The employee was nice enough to bring me hummus upon request but it was just and overall underwhelming experience. If you are looking for authentic food and a great experience you should try another place.
I am a person always looking for the positive in a restaurant but this was very disappointing. Did not even finish the food.... owners please check in on your place, experience is as important as the food.

Its a little business back in a shopping center, kinda like a hole in the wall, but a very clean hole in the wall. It's family owned, which I love and the couple who own it are always super sweet & make you feel welcomed. 

The food is always fresh and delicious. I get the Lamb gyro with the herb glazed fries. AMAZING! I don't feel so yucky after eating there either. I need to try different things on the menu but that is my favorite right now.

My family and I had a craving for some Mediterranean food, did some yelp searching and saw that Baladie had amazing reviews so decided to give it a try.

We were totally blown away! Everything we ordered was delicious!! We had the basket of Mediterranean Chicken wings and Fries which had the most amazing seasoning. My mom usually doesn't eat fried food but she couldn't stop snacking on the fries after the first bite!

My mom and wife had the Lamb Kabob and Chicken Kabob which are cooked to order. They were definitely worth the wait! Both meats were tender and juicy, cooked perfectly. The rice that came with the Kabobs was delicious too!

I had the Gyro Platter, I inhaled it the second it was put in front of me. Literally there was nothing left on my plate. I would've drank the sauce too if I wasn't health conscious.

We will definitely be back for more to try your other foods! Thanks Richie (I think is the boss) Thanks everyone at Baladie!
Was very pleased with the Greek salad my girlfriend got, as well as the lamb gyro was phenomenal. Definitely gotta visit again when we're on that side of town =D

1 star = Terrible. Multiple things went wrong. Never going back.
2 star = Not good. I will not go back, but it wasnt absolutely awful.
3 star = Good, not great. I wouldnt go out of my way, but I *would* go back.
4 star = Excellent food. I really liked it. I could be a regular here.
5 star = Phenomenal food. Something truly special here.

We really loved Baladie Cafe! The food was delicious and the owner and his wife were super nice. 

We had the gyro plate, the shawarma plate, and the grape leaves and it was all awesome. The baklava was PERFECT. Baklava can be too moist or too dry, but BC's was just right.

The only reason that we might consider trying another Greek place is that BC is kind of a haul from Summerlin, but the owners were so nice I would feel like I was cheating on them :)

Dont hesitate to try this place.

First off the owners of this joint make you feel like friends the moment you walk in and the food matches their warmth!  If you like GOOD Mediterranean food this is the place for you.

I had the shawerma with the spicy humus and it was top notch.  The pitas and humus were great and the meat very flavorful.  My wife had the gyro wrap with the lamb and commented that it was the best gyro she has ever had.  To finish we got the pistachio and walnut baklava, I was in heaven.

It has been a long times since I have enjoyed food this good and hospitality this friendly.  We will be making Baladie Cafe one of our regular stops!
I'm sorry to say but this place wasn't up to my excpectations.. The food was good but they were okay portions.. After I ate there, I was never going back there..
Amazing shawerma that is good to eat by itself or as a pita wrap. Definitely a place you'll want to come to often!

The food is amazing & fresh, tender and home made.  We had lamb & beef shawerma, lamb & chicken kabobs, tabouli, hummus, baklavas is so fresh and flaky  the whole meal was perfect !!!  Highly recommended
This place is always awesome. I came here when it was the previous owners and was always happy. The new owners have kept the same flavors and they are very sweet. I love eating here!

Place closed 15 min early so we drove all the way there after calling to confirm they closed at 8 and we got there at 7:45 and they were closed. We could see them inside cleaning but ignored us.  Just moved here and they missed out on a great customer.
Staff is extremely friendly. Laid back atmosphere and good food. Brought my son and my husband for a dinner  glad I found this spot  highly recommend it

Good food, tasty and fresh.  We ordered chicken shawerma and a beef and lamb gyro.  Reminded me of Mad Greek, but much better.  Very filling.  The pistacho baklava is yummy.

The owners are very nice and courteous.  They deserve a 5 star review.

The restaurant  has new owners now. The new owners were regular customers to the previous owners. They are keeping within the tradition of friendliness and warmth as I have experienced so many times before at the restaurant.

I was in the area of Lone Mountain yesterday, April 9th 2013. I looked up Yelp for a restaurant for lunch, near where I was. The search resulted in recommending Baladie restaurant, four and a half  star.  I immediately got into my car and drove to this place, thinking to get a good lunch.

Upon entry into the restaurant I was taken aback by the lack of restaurant like atmosphere, newspapers were thrown on tables and chairs, a untidy place. Chairs and tables were placed in a way, that told me there was lack of interest.

I ordered gyro, as this was recommended by review on this place.  My culture is  close to Middle Eastern and Mediterranean, so I have eaten many a gyro in my lifetime. 
The food arrived in  plate with thin strips of gyro, thinner than I have ever seen, one thin slice of tomato, cut into half, looked the sliced tomato came out of fridge where it had been for two or three days, three slices of cucumber, healthy looking, few thin strips of lettuce, one and a half poor quality pita bread, menu suggested, two pita breads, and what is supposed to ptassiki sauce.

The sauce was lebni which tasted like lebni one buys in grocery shops.  It was no where near the taste of ptassiki sauce.  The thin strips of beef and lamb meat gyro was, microwave reheated, taste was of reheated gyro, where the strips had been lying around for a day, very disappointing.  Tomato was old, too. Thin srtips of lettuce were, well thin strips of lettuce.  The only item that was fresh was cucumber.
Between old reheated gyro meat, old tomato, ptassiki sauce which was lebni out of a container, poor quality pita bread, one can imagine, the meal was disgusting to say the least.  
At a cost of $8.34/-, this gyro lunch was, and no exaggeration, the worst I have
 ever come across.
It seems the people who run Baladie restaurant have made little or no effort to provide good food, to provide fresh food and what is even more annoying, Yelp has given this restaurant 4 - 1/2 star rating.
This meal should not cost more than $3.50 after tax, infact, it should not be served in the way it was served to me.
Very irresponsible of Baladie restaurant.

This place is delicious. I begin to salivate when i anticipate going there for  lunch.  Fresh food and ingredients.  Good friendly service.  This place is run by husband and wife and service can be a little slow, but definitely worth it.

Overall good experiences in two recent visits.  Good food, good prices, good portions, good service & staff.  I especially enjoyed the beef & lamb gyros, chicken gyros, chicken kabobs and the desserts.  The fries and special sauce are fantastic and the staff is wonderful.

I have lived in the area for a long time.  I don't stop here as often as I should.  Today we wanted Gyros so I ordered ahead for pick up.  New faces I've not met but I believe a stranger is just a friend you have not met yet.  Very friendly staff, Gyros were good, perfect spice and flavor, I did ask for spicy and must remember to verify that in the future, maybe extra spicy.  The Gyros now are a little light on the meat compared to the previous but delicious
I've lived in NYC, LA, been to the Middle East, and I eat at Baladie practically every day.  What does that tell you?  The owners bring the real thing folks!  See you there soon!

Ordered the Chicken Gyro and The Green Hawaiian smoothie. The best gyro I have had in a long time. I gladly recommend this to anyone reading. You will not be disappointed with the food or the service. 10/10.

We LOVE going here not only for the food but for the conversation. The couple who owns Baladie are from Algiers and treat you like family. The Mrs. is usually in the back cooking away, and the Mr. chats with us about foreign affairs (he's an admitted news addict). Highly recommend the gyros (they're huge!), seasoned fries, and authentic hummus.
I adore this place, the staff is wonderful and the food is amazing! Definitely one of my favorite places to eat!

My wife and have regular date nights here.  We share the greek fries. We both get the combo plate and go home with leftovers.  The gyros are great, but welove the mousaka.  The baklava is wonderful too.  The owners are very friendly and accomodating.

I used to love this place but everything is different with the new owners. It still looks very similar but the taste of the food has totally changed. In the past I could not stop eating the fries and special sauce. I just walked out after eating there and I hardly touched my fries and sauce because it tasted strange. The gyros that allowed this place to stay open during the recession taste different. I won't be returning. Which is a shame because I loved going to this hole in the wall local pace for so many years.

The gyros are to die for! The service is fantastic and I think they have the best fries I have ever tried at a restaurant! One io my favorite locally owned restaurants!
I would say after trying other Mediterranean restaurants I think this one is by far the best overall!

I just went here for lunch today (1-4-14) with my brother, after hearing many good things about this place. 

I have to say, the food is great and the owners are wonderful people. I normally don't comment on each and every place I go to eat, but this experience really earned it. 

We ordered the beef and lamb gyro with spicy sauce and their seasoned fries. The gyro was amazing, and the fries come with a really nice garlic / herb  paste that has a very unique and pleasant taste. The prices are fair and the seating/ambiance is comforting. Its a small mom and pop shop so its not a fancy dining experience, but it's a very cozy, comfortable and causal place to eat. 

Even better than the food is the hospitality. The owners are both very sweet and friendly. I will definitely be coming back here to eat, and I would recommend it to anyone who likes authentic Greek or Mediterranean food.

Lemme start off by saying that this place is the bomb.  I learned about this place through my brother and I gotta say, its one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas.  For the price, you can't beat it.  For the delicious food and experience, there is no replacement.  I get treated like family whenever I come in and grab a bite to eat, and it shows in the food.  It is prepared so wonderfully and masterfully that I seriously come here to eat at least twice a week, if not more.  I've gone through everything on their menu and I've never hit a bad spot.  The gyro is amazing, the lamb kebab  is moist, and the spanakopita is spectacular.  I love this place and I love these people.

Not the same quality/taste that I have come to expect from Baladi Cafe. Could have been an off day. Ordered a gyro. The gyro meat was a little dry and there was a ton of sauce. Fries were good as always. Will come back in the future.
Great food made with love !   A real "mom & pop" place in all the good ways.   Nothing pre- packaged or scooped out of a 5 gallon bucket here.  Only home made goodness.  Thanks Yelp

Since trying out halal at Halal Guys in NYC, my friends and I have been looking for a place that has good Mediterranean food w/ the same white sauce. Baladie is not only the closest to having that same white sauce (common tzatziki sauce isn't the same thing), but their food was amazing. We had the #2, which is a gyro platter w/ a beef/lamb mix for the meat. We chose rice (good choice in the end) instead of the vegetables. Best Mediterranean food we've had in town. Also, their baklava is going to have me dreaming about it for the next few weeks. 

The guy (I'm assuming the owner, along w/ his wife?) was super friendly and had a good sense of humor, to go along w/ great customer service. Definitely a 5 star place that I'll be hitting up again in the future.

If you are shawarma lovers like us, you are in for a treat ! This place is a treasure chest full of delights like falafel, lentil soup and wraps :) we had both chicken and beef/lamb shawarma and BOTH were really good! Mild sauce, good meat, just the right amount of lettuce - perfect combination and a recipe to win us as loyal customers :)
My family always went to a Greek festival in the SFV in Cali. This is close as it gets
Their customer service is great! The owner and his wife are very sweet. We had a gyro, a shawarma, and fries. There was a sauce that the wife makes for the fries and it is out of this world!

Didn't realize it's been so long since my last visit. So far, I've seen a lot of improvements; the new owners are super friendly and make you feel welcome. The food still looks delicious and I've got to be honest the place looks cleaner. Definitely worth the visit!
This is the real deal. 5 stars all the way. The proprietor is super friendly, the food is legit and the service is exceptional.  Try the babaghanoush.

I frequented Baladie Cafe at least twice a week for over a month in May 2011 while I was working in the area. I have waited far too long to write this review. The food is excellent!! The owners, a husband and wife duo, run the cafe daily and are very friendly. The grape leaves are the best I have ever had second only to Granada Cafe in Herndon, VA. The shorba is amazing as is the lamb kabob. I've tried nearly everything on the menu and really have nothing bad to say about the place. Service is warm, prompt, and friendly and the food is superb.

Actually, I am really sad to write this review. I even went and read other reviews and have seen I am not the only one. I too LOVED the previous owners and have been going to this place for years. They watched our son grow up ! We all love those Mom and Pop places and it truly was great food, customer service, and all around wonderful. When it was new owners , although we missed the old ones, we were optimistic because we were assured that everything will be the same. The lady was nice and food was good. Then we came back about a month later and got a different girl, she was okay and food was just okay. We just went two days ago and I was not happy at all. The thing is the food was better that last time, but not much better. Maybe we thought it was better because we waited 45 minutes to get it ! We walked in, no one else was waiting for food, only one other table was seated and already eating. We ordered from a girl who didn't really care if we were there or not. She wasn't rude, she also wasn't even looking at us when we ordered. When we paid she said it would be about 15 minutes. Okay, no worries about that. Then after about 15 minutes or so two guys walked in. Two guys that they knew apparently . They chatted up with them and were friendly with them. And in about 5-7 minutes those guys got their food ! And the owner lady ( we had met her before ) walked by and said " your food will be right out guys ".  While we continued to sit and listen to her chat these young men up as well for a few minutes.  At this point I checked my receipt to check the print out time and realized how long we had been sitting and waiting...45 minutes !!!! I got upset at this. I was just about to ask for a full refund and go some where else. My husband said we should just wait because we had already waited this long. About 47 minutes of waiting and out the food came. We had two gyros with seasoned fries,Greek salad, and two chicken kabobs. The food was alright. We noticed the fries were a bit over cooked and the chicken on the chicken kabob was on the dry side. Not to bad really, but the wait was stupid long and it was like they didn't care at all, not one bit. What is really sad is the charm is gone from this place. I could hear the owner talking about how to market etc, problem is you have lost another customer. In fact you lost  our table of 4 customers. Plus we used to recommend this place to everyone, and used to take countless people here and now we have to find a new place. When times were tough a few years back we used to dine here at least once a week to make sure we did our part to keep this place alive. Now I don't care, because they haven't cared. I don't care about décor . What made this place great was the customer service and the food. Before when it was just Mira, some times we did have to wait about 20 to 25 minutes if there were busy, but they checked on us and were so sweet and friendly. It is really sad to write this, it ALL could have been avoided if customer service was better. I have been in customer service for years so I understand when a place is busy or swamped but they were not. Being in customer service I give the benefit of the doubt  and not give others a hard time because I hate it when some ones bad attitude is taken out on me. But in this case, the complete disregard for our patronage can not be just let alone, I had to say something.
This is our go-to place for delicious homemade gyros and hummus.  It is owned by a very nice couple who consistently provide excellent service and quality food.

Great food, friendly service. Everything is freshly made.  We loved the hummus and dolmas.  The lamb and chicken gyro excellent. My hubby loved the chicken kabob. The owners are very friendly and help to ensure all their patrons are happy and well fed. We will be back!

I would give this place 6 stars if I could. The owners treat you like friends and the food is just phenomenal. They make everything fresh to order so we got to relax for a few minutes while they made the kabob. The shawarma gyro was the best thing in a pita I've ever had. You can tell they take pride in the quality of the food and ingredients. Definitely will be going back repeatedly.

Food was super delicious!! Gyros are a great. The special seasoning and special sauce (secret ingredients according to the restaurant owner) were my fave! Service was phenomenal, incredibly friendly, attentive, and, we really enjoyed a great conversation with the owner. 

Also, I really appreciated the fact that they offer the option of reusable cups and utensils for the environmentally conscious folks out there. 

Definitely check it out!!!! :D
Friendly staff and delicious food! We had the greek platter, gyro platter and chicken kabob. The chicken Kabob took a bit longer than expected but it was delish!
Excellent fresh food, great prices. The shawerma was very good! We are definitely coming back.

Places like this are why I love yelp. With less than an hour for lunch while visiting from out of town, my wife and I were delighted to find this place. We shared a delicious lamb kabob - perfectly marinated and tender, with a simple rice pilaf and pita on the side. Super friendly owners, who answered all of our questions with grace and humor. Nice to know the lamb is halal.
Authentic Mediterranean food at a fair price. Small place with friendly service. You will wait awhile for the food but it's worth it. Baklava is GREAT.

I randomly walked into Baladie while in the shopping center. Hacene warmly greeted me and recommended his gyro and seasoned fries. I immensely enjoyed both and have since been back to eat their breakfast. It was a nice bagel and lox bagel sandwich and I highly recommend stopping in.
A truly awesome place - it's family owned and operated and I've been coming here for years. The food is fresh and delicious and the service is wonderful! Give it a try, you will be hooked!
Not what I expected according to reviews food was dry not a whole lot of flavor disappointed will not return.
Decent food. Friendly people but nothing special and definitely not authentic... I had the chicken shawarna and it lacked sauce and the chicken didn't have popping flavors.

I love the chicken shawerma!
 I absolutely loved it! Just thought I would say it twice! 
The Baladie Cafe has a very friend and up beat staff. The food was awesome and I was so pleased we stopped in! 
Definitely going back as soon as I can and I hope everyone will  give it a try!

Hands down the best place to get a gyro in Las Vegas! I have not tried any of their other food but if you are looking for a good gyro Baladie Cafe is the place to go. 

Also, enjoy seeing the kind and happy owners behind the counter every time. They are very sweet.

Service was great, the woman behind the counter was very courteous and kind. Three stars because the Apricot juice I bought expired on Jan. 14, 2014. That's just careless inventory stocking--didn't make a big deal about it, but hopefully that gets addressed. Besides that, food was delicious and made in a timely manner.
Food was amazing and authentic. The people are super nice. :) they always treat us well and make sure that we like the food. We eat there often!
Decent food- I ordered lamb. I was hoping for really good Greek food in a place close to home. The people were really nice. Overall, good!

We ordered the soup with some kind of ground wheat (forgot the name), lamb & beef plate thing, beef kabob, and pistachio baklava.  Everything was pretty good except for the kabobs.  The meat was super tough and the rice that came with it was pretty bland.  When I told the guy owner he replied with,"Well, it's beef." as if that's how beef is supposed to be.

But I digress since we did stop there at closing time.  Both owners were super friendly too, they even let us sample some of the beef & lamb thing before we ordered anything.  I'll definitely be back to try some of the other stuff they have.
Best baklava and gyros ever!!! Amazing customer service, real sweet ppl :) stayed for 2 hours talking with owners-- fun, friendly,great hangout

This place used to be amazing until they sold it a few months ago. Now nearly all of the menu prices have been bumped up a couple dollars and the food isn't as good. On top of that the previous owners used to greet my wife and I and we're always super friendly and sociable which is no longer the case. We used to be regulars but probably won't come back anymore.
The Greek sampler is a good way to sample their gyros, spanakopita, moussaka, and dolmades.  This is a nice place to get some economical Greek food and the owners are very nice as well.

My wife and I are new in town, and we were looking for a new place to eat. So I looked on trusty Yelp for some suggestions. This place was the highest rated food in 20 miles, so I knew we had to go. Incredibly glad we did!

We both had the lamb & beef gyro's (YEE-RO!) and a side of fries, and they were EPIC! Incredibly fresh, and fulll of flavor.

The guy that took our order, who I assume was the owner was HILARIOUS and added to the great experience. He even gave us some sage advice for living in Las Vegas that was accurate and funny.

We will definitely go back, and DEFINITELY recommend it to anyone looking for some amazing food! Thanks Yelp!

Super happy that the owner took my input and changed the tzatziki sauce to yoghurt base instead of sour cream. BRAVO! Brought my out of town friends here. Absolutely love it. Great family restaurant!!!

Turned on to this place by my landlady and couldn't be happier. Only been twice and so far have found the owners gracious , the food authentic and delicious  and the prices incredibly low for the quality given.  I will be back and suggest that you give this mom and pop a try.

If you are looking for authentic greek food 
This is the spot not to mention their excellent customer service!! Highly recommended!!
Great food ! It's the best Mediterranean cafe I have been to. Very friendly! The baklava dessert is fantastic!

My review for Baladie Cafe is overdue. Granted it's been a while since our visit, I never got around to posting my review. Went here with my folks who live in Summerlin based on all the amazing reviews. Tiny child sized portions of mediocre food, High prices. Don't believe the hype. Save your time, gas and hard earned money. Eat somewhere else.

Man, I hate giving one stars. But this place needs to call Gordon Ramsey's kitchen nightmares show. I have no clue where the 4 and 5 star reviews come from.  This place sucks. My boyfriend and I were in the area and decided to give it a shot.  

First of all the owner, is amazing. Really nice guy. Walking in, the place is hideous. Everything is outdated. 

Food wise:
1. Our chicken shawarma and gyro "platter" meat was microwaved. Disgusting! 
2. The platter itself was literally, a de-constructed, terribly cut, over-seasoned pita wrap. And we paid a few dollars more for it.
3.  The veggies were frozen. WTF. 

So disappointed. The baklava was slimy too. It was really strange.  Yes, I paid for all of it.  

Please taste your food before serving it. Because, it's pretty bad.

I called in to place the order for delivery they said they cannot deliver since there's only one person that works there strike one, I decided to place an order for pick up they said it will take 15 minutes for it to be ready I got there after 20 minutes they said the food was coming right out and I had to wait another 15 minutes for the food to come out.Fiinally I grab the food came home I paid for lamb chops as it says lamb chops in the menu it were not chops it was just regular lamb meat which was very rough to chew it was bland I asked for medium it was well done next I asked for chicken, the chicken was very dry and it was bland no flavor not to mention there were bay leaves in my rice I had to sit and pick out the Bay leaves out of my rice and I thought that was very disturbing. The taziki sauce was either hot or old it had bubbles coming out of tge taziki sauce I thought that was very nasty.  it doesn't come with the salad or anything like that it was only rice and meat then I ask for gyro fries tge Gyro fries was not fries it was a Gyro salad since it was filled with lettuce. I was even scared to feed my dog i paid
Over $45 to throw it in tge farbage. Next time I want Mediterranean food I know where to go SHAWARMA HOUSE.


I don't have anything to do with your competitors I just like to eat Mediterranean food when I crave I like trying different places and I'm just being honest I'm sorry if I was rough I didn't mean to hurt you however I was being honest once again I called in the order and I Asked your employee if it was lamb chops your employee was well convinced it was. I will stop by again next time and talk to you when I get to that side of town

Fresh, "real" food made by some of the nicest people in Las Vegas. Don't be put off by the location in a mall. The food is one thousand times better than what you'd find in a fancier place. The difference is in the freshness of the ingredients and the homemade quality. Try the roasted chicken with paprika and carmelized onions or the chicken skewers with rice. Also great is the Greek salad, gyro platter, and of course baklava for dessert! Support small, independent businesses like this one rather than corporate chains that care more about profits than quality. You will not be disappointed!

Upon entering the restaurant, I was greeted by a friendly owner.  This is a nice and hidden mom and pop store which allowed me to get to know the owners better.  I got the schwarma, baklava, and turkish coffee, all of which were delicious.  The meat slices could have been cut thicker, but the seasoning and amount of provided food was excellent.

Why did it take me so long to write a review for this place......I've been in love with it for years!  Truly a little gem in the northwest.  The couple/owners are so inviting and do always remember your face or name.  The salad is to die for.....I'm not kidding, it's probably the best, most consistantly yummy greek salad I've had.  Always fresh cool and crisp and the greek dressing mixed with feta crumbles really just take it over the top.   Try the lamb and beef schwerma....yum the hummus just completes the flavors of this wrap.  Their kabobs with the basmati rice and side of seasoned tomato sauce is also a favorite of mine.  Ooooops.....cannot forget their ahhhhhhmazzzing fries with the special seasoning that is truly addicting.  

Can't say enough about this place.  I'm lucky to live and work in the area so I visit as often as my tummy tells me to, which is a lot!  

Support your locals!
Nice people, good food definitely will be coming back for more. Make sure to try the beef/lamb gyro and especially the seasoned fries!

Under new management, still the same friendly service! Some new things added to the menu like smoothies and chicken wings. We both got the lamb & beef gyro pita wraps... very filling! The seasoned fries are addicting too. 

Only con? A little location so tables fill up quick depending on day/time. Also, they have no restroom inside (but the owner was so generous to let me use their employee restroom, as I literally was about to burst!).

We will definitely be back! Thank you for a delicious meal and impeccable service! :)

I love this place!!

They have bagels on weekend mornings. You can get them plain with just cream cheese or made into delectable sandwiches. It's an easy decision to chose this place rather than McDonald's across the street!

I haven't had a chance to try much of their other foods, but the dolmas are some of the best I have had and a very good price. You can order 6 to go for around $2.50. There are a lot of vegetarian options as well. Their baklava is homemade and absolutely divine (not to mention beautiful)

The staff is very friendly and after you have been there a couple of times they will remember you, which I like.

My first Yelp review and it had to be done. Outstanding fresh Mediterranean food that is hard to beat. Owners are friendliest in the business. Prices are certainly reasonable for the quality you get. By far the best babaghanouj I've ever had. Been going here for years. Lucky that such a great, unique place is so close to me. Menu is simple and they will alter anything you want to your liking. Stop by and dine in or get it to go you won't be disappointed.
I ordered shawarma platter and was so delicious. The service was good, no customers restroom, the price a little bit high compare to the portion size.

Always a pleasure to be served here.
The only gyro I know, so its hard to compare against anything else.
But, there's no complaints from me or my family when I bring dinner home from Baladie.

Update, the gyro fries are amazing.

I'm sorry but the salad my friend got was overly expensive, and the gyro wasn't good at all, the pita was cold, and had absolutely no flavor, meat was cold. The seasoned fries were really good and the sauce they use. I wouldn't mind paying $11-12.00 for fries and a gyro but it was just not good at all. 
The owner was incredibly nice and very welcoming but unfortunately the food needs more TLC.

I stopped in here for lunch. Both the food and service were top notch.  I ordered a falafel and a Gyro with the herb fries. Their fries were very tasty, and had a delicious seasoning sprinkled on them. The gyro was also well seasoned, with a good portion of meat. You definitely get a good bang for your buck. I'll be back soon :)

This is a great place to dine in at lunch with a friend or family, the environment is so bright and nice, the owners are very kind and make you feel like close friends and make sure you enjoy your experience. The food is very reasonably priced and very good, alot of the food is handmade and is something you cant find anywhere else. They prepare the food fast and make sure the ingredients are of good quality. My favorite meal is the chicken kabob and i love how it is made fresh everytime and it is very delicious. I love coming here regularly and talking with the owners and enjoying the great environment and food, the cafe has been in business for over 10 years so they know what theyre doing. the owners just changed but they are keeping it the same and they are just as good as the old ones. Definitely will be coming back often

Great food and great people that own that restaurants....they are friendly and the food is amazing....try the Turkish coffee its excelent....food you cant go wrong with anything they have....its all fresh!

Best Mediterranean food I have had !
I've been here quite a few times over the past few months and I am absolutely in love with their Gyros and fries! Great prices and even better food
Would definitely recommend to anyone and everyone !!!

Love their food! The owners are so nice! I love the breakfast bagel and the gyros are so tasty. I would eat here every night if I could.  The Manhattan bagel is so big I had to share it with someone!  If your looking for a nice family run business they are the people you want to support!

Sometimes, you just need to satisfy the gyro fix.  This is a great spot for it.  Very quaint little spot, tucked away in an inconspicuous location.  The staff is friendly and the food is just delicious.  Nothing fancy here.  Cafeteria style ordering, simple tables and chairs, and served with plastic utensils.  That's good enough for me.

My wife and I came in after seeing great reviews and they were well deserved. We told the owner that it was our first time and he told us about the place and the most popular order (lamb and beef gyro). He even prepared a sample of the meat before we ordered it. Very friendly and the gyro was delicious with cucumber dill sauce. My wife ordered a chicken sandwich which was delicious too. Then we got dessert. I had rice pudding and my wife had baklava, both were very good.

Gyro wrap combo with mint tea. Wow. It's been 6 months since I had been here and under new ownership it is wonderful. The tzaziki is now fresh and made properly with yogurt. The wrap is bursting with lamb and beef and the crunch of the cucumber is so fresh. The frys and fry sauce leave you wanting more. The employees are very helpful and wonderful to speak with. PI will not be waiting another six months before I come back. 

Well done!

This place has a variety of different options for Mediterranean food such as sherwma(sp?), lamb + beef, kebabs, etc. This is probably the only place in this area that serves this type of food, and I'm definitely a fan. 

NLV area rarely has any variety different from the normal chain restaurants, chinese food, and mexican food. 

We stopped in last night for a healthier choice of meal. I ordered the Mediterranean plate ($8.99) which was an assortment of hummus, tabuleh, dolmathes, some fresh pita, fresh cucumber, feta, and falafels. 

The food definitely had some quality and precision to it. The dolmathes were wrapped tightly and they were like bite sized. The hummus was super fresh and tasty.  I'm a huge picky hummus person. I absolutely hate the hummus from Vons/Smith's etc. This hummus wasn't too salty and the consistency was perfect. 

The falafel's were crisp and fluffy inside. I wasn't a huge fan of em but my bf liked them. They were more like hush puppies to me. lol. 

The bf got the lamb &  beef plate which came with the strips of tasty meat. They both gave us a side of fresh pita. 

We also took home a box of baklava (6pc) were $8 and they were so amazing. Not too sweet and sticky on the bottom. You have a choice of either pistachio or pecan baklava. If you buy just one, it's $1.50  

The owners were talking to us, they were super friendly and really made us feel like we were part of the family! 

We'll definitely be back!

Whenever I feel like a having a pita wrap I go here for their gyro's and shawerma. Love their seasoned fries with dipping sauce. But with the new year, I'm cutting back on the fries. I need to explore their other selections. 

The owner's here are extremely nice. 

I'll be back many times.

I've been craving authentic Mediterranean food since Europe. I had not found a single place comparable to the little mom and pop place in Germany serving Istanbul style gyros. This place is the closest that I've found in Vegas. Probably the best in town! I ordered a plate of swarma which is a gyros except it's served with hummus instead of tiziki. The plate had enough food to make 3 swarmas! Plenty of food at only $9.99. The meat served was amazing. Super tasty, extra tender, and plenty of it! The pita was served warm with cucumbers, tomatoes, as well as lettuce. The hummus was tasty with a hint of citrus to it adding a tang to it. I love the fact that the pita was not too thick or too thin! If it's too thick, you can't taste anything except for dough in your mouth. If it's too thin the pita breaks and does not have the capacity to hold your veggies and meat on. The taste and the proportions was perfect! 

Oh and of course the fries!!! Don't forget the fries. They served it was a new house made ranch that is too die for. I personally liked it better than the original dipping sauce. The cashier was friendly. Super helpful. And welcoming. He was a Jordanian gentlemen who shared a passion for travel like myself. Kudos to him for making my solo dinner perfect!
Always good food and friendly service! The Mediterranean food is the classic standards, but the bagel breakfast sandwiches are a Saturday treat!

This is one of my favorite medateranian food places in all of Las Vegas. It is family owned and operated, they are both amazing people and super friendly as well as super helpful for the company that you bring for the first time that doesn't know what they want. I always get the lamb and beef gyros and it never disappointing. If I was you I'd put it on my vegas bucket list.

I'm always a little nervous when my husband brings me to a hole-in-the-wall place, but to my delight this place didn't disappoint! The owners were incredibly friendly and my gyro was equally tastey. 

We were just in the area running an errand and happened upon the joint via Yelp reviews. If we lived closer I'd say for sure we would be back. Giving it 4 stars only because the aesthetics weren't great.
This place is great. Great food,service and everyone is right, the people who run this place are a delightful couple.

This was my first time eating here.I Had The spicy Lamb and Beef Shawerma ,My wife tried the Spicy Lamb and beef gyro.We both Thought are food was delicious!I Will have to try the rest of their menu in future.I recomend this place to everyone,Enjoy!

This place is wonderful. The owners are very nice every time I go to order and the food is very delicious, it's hard to find authentic Greek food and the place hits the spot. Their seasoned fries are to die for. I love this please and recommend everyone try it!

Small place mostly for take outs with pretty good food.  I had the tasty gyros plate.  Friendly owner operators.  Location is deep in the plaza that seems to be busier lately.  Place would do betterr if it was well known with a better sign and facing street but nevertheless it has my business.

Great little Greek Food place in North Las Vegas. After looking at online reviews, we decided to come here and we were not disappointed! We split a gyros plate (#2) and a side of French fries. The gyro meat was outstanding and the fries were crispy yet soft. Sauce was tasty and different. Only downfall was portions were a little smaller than anticipated.

I truly had high expectations for this place based on the yelp reviews, but sadly I was let down. I came in on a Thursday afternoon to a completely empty restaurant. Placed a to go order and was on my way after 35 minutes of waiting. No problem! Should be fresh since it took so long right?? NO, WRONG. I ordered a beef shawarma platter (around $10,  a falafel platter, and a side of rice. The beef was dry, bland, and honestly, a very small portion for the price paid. The falafel tasted like they were frozen at some point mainly because of that strange stale texture that defrosted frozen food takes on when cooked. The rice and hummus were good and the lady who took my order was very kind. Unfortunately, since I don't just want to eat hummus and rice I probably will no return.

This place is amazing! If you are looking for a great gyro this is the place to go! This is ran by a husband and wife who are amazing people! They are so friendly and great to talk to! We go there once a week now because we love it so much
They have good gyros! Still taste the same with the new owners,. The seasoned fries are delicious! And the awesome  dipping sauce!! Reasonable prices and baklava looks yummo..

The great reviews are not a TRUE reflection of this place. 

This is NOT an authentic Greek resturant. Be  aware!!! My biggest complaint about this place...the food is not cooked fresh :-( 

I ordered a chicken greek salad, which tasted pretty good, but the meat was processed. I politely asked the male owner about the chicken, who responded by saying the chicken was fresh, they season it, grill it and then "heat" it up in the oven as it's ordered. If the meat is heated up, is it "heated up" in a microwave??? 

The pita bread that comes with the salad was cold and hard. I couldn't even eat it. I asked the owner if the bread was always that hard. He responded with an attitude and told me the bread is NOT cooked fresh at the store. They put herbs and oil in it and heat it up. He continued to respond with an attitude and asked me if I wanted my money back. 

When I decide to dine out (especially at a Greek resturant), I expect for my food to be cooked fresh, without it being processed!

So I have been going to this place for about seven years. Always excellent service and food. But the place was sold less than a year ago and I can see a big change in the service. I have ordered the same thing every time I've gone there this time I had to ask the girls to wash her hands you never mess with food when you just handle money. That is basic common sense which she did not seem to have. Then she got my order wrong and told me that I didn't order what I ordered I did not argue but I will never go there again. You can't hire just anyone up the street to be at the front of your business. I will never  patronize this Business again.
Warm friendly family owned restaurant. Food is very fresh and good. I would definitely go back and eat. Very authentic. Yummy!!
Great Mediterranean place! Good portion sizes and freshly made. Tasty and wide variety of choices!
Highly recommended, excellent food and it was like having dinner at home, very friendly owners. I love mom and pops style restaurants.  Thank you for your hard work.
By far the BEST greek salad i have ever had! Food is so fresh and tastes sooo good! The waitress went above and beyond making my salad and serving me. Thank You!
Best Gyros in town, excellent customer service, always so welcoming! We love this place!! Highly recommended!

Friendliest owners of any place I've been to, hands down. The food is the freshest of any Mediterranean I've ever had! A friend and I enjoyed a Greek salad and I think it's the New York bagel.... I can't remember the name exactly... But it was an onion bagel with smear, lox, onion, tomatoes, and capers. Soooo delicious!

This place smells like absolute heaven when you walk in, and the lady running the counter and kitchen is as sweet as can be! Unfortunately, the taste did not quite live up to my expectations.

Ordered a Greek salad, add gyro meat, and a traditional lamb gyro, both to go. The salad was overdressed and I had to add a ton of spinach at home to get the proportions right- it was drenched, even with some dressing leaking out the side of the takeout box. Accompanying pita was seasoned with herbs, crisp as a cracker, and almost painfully salty to eat. 
Took a bite of my guy's gyro and didn't care for the tzatziki sauce used- can't put my finger on it, but it was too much like straight sour cream and too light on the flavor for my liking. BF said it was fine, but he wasn't blown away by it. Gyro meat was a little lower in quality than I expected and seemed less than fresh.

This place is out of the way for me, so I likely won't be returning, but their pricing is good and they'll do when a craving strikes.

The food here was pretty good. My wife had a gyro and I had a beef /lamb shawarma. The fries are delicious! Overall, food quality 3.5/5

The guy at the register was really friendly and it was good to have a place like that open so early so we were so excited to try this new place out.

One thing that really grinds my gears... Are restaurant /dine in places that don't have customer rest rooms! Thank goodness it was just me and my wife or we would all be making separate trips to the sears outlet, 5 stores away! I would never take my  4 years old and 1 year old here. Ridiculous! If the food is amazing then I would consider going back but i just don't have any reasons to do so. 

*insert sad face *

We have been a at least half a dozen times and loved it each time, the owners are so sweet and helpful with the menu.  We usually get moussaka and maybe a gyro or chicken dish, never have been unhappy with the food.  I LOVE LOVE LOVE the garlic fries and that sauce..i could drink it.  I always get extra to dip anything and everything with!!  This is a place we will continue to go to on a regular basis.

Delicious food!  Great family place.  The guy always remembers me and my husband and remembers what we order.  The hummus and pita bread is amazing!

We had a greek place when we were stationed in Texas, but now here in Vegas, we were worried there would be to many places to have any place of real worth.  I am so glad we found this place! This is exactly what we needed.

We love this place and have been here at least 8 times since finding it on yelp in the summer.

The food is soooo yummy!  We have tried a few different things all good but I can't get past the falafel.  

Also love the couple who own this place!

It's been awhile since I've visited Baladie Cafe. Way too long. I've missed the great food. Richie, the owner, was very friendly and explained some new menu options. All the original options are still available, including the seasoned fries. 
I tried the babaganouj. Wow! The tomato slices brought out the incredible flavor! I would go back today and order just the babaganouj and tomatoes. Although we arrived at 7:30, the staff was very accommodating and made us a special meal. 
Make sure to visit and help a local owner keep his business successful.
Awesome little mom and pop place. I never knew I liked lamb until I had one of their gyros. They've been there for 6 years apparently and I never knew.

Delicious gyros! Lived in Vegas for almost 2 years & resigned myself to mediocre gyros as a sacrifice for all the other amazing things here. A friend tipped me off to this place & I'm so glad she did. The gyro meat is well-seasoned (my biggest gripe about the gyros at gyro time & market cafe) and plentiful. The fries are seasoned with oregano & pepper. Yum!

What a find! New owners Richie & Tami were very welcoming and super friendly..we had a few laughs! Everything we ordered was excellent, but totally loved the Mediterranean seasoned fries with Tami's secret sauce! I had the Gyro platter and hubs had the Shawerma platter, both fresh and delish. Desserts & Turkish coffee were #YUM!  Excited to have another local owned eatery to promote and frequent..and close to home = bonus!!

I've been coming here now for about 2 years now and I can't say how great the food is! Not only is the food great but the staff and owner are so nice. I gave this place a 5 star because there has never been a time that I've ordered food here and not loved it. Everything I've had here is great. I would definitely recommend this place to satisfy your  mediterranean craving.
My brother and I went in and both got beef/lamb gyros combos, the food was great and the girl who served us was super friendly. We will definitely be back. Oh and the smoothie was amazing too!

Food is delicious , i had a chicken gyro with a greek salad and fries and let me tell you it was my first time here and i will definitely be going back , worth the money the only thing is that they take long to make the food but . The best greek place closer to my house

When it comes to Greek food this place is 2 legit to quit. I'm assuming that the folks that are working in there most of the time are the owners. They are extremely hospitable and friendly! The food here is awesome! The Gyro's are my favorite and are a must have with some of the seasoned fries. Oh man and the sauce they give you with the fries, I don't know what's in it but it's heavenly and I could eat it by the gallon. I love supporting mom and pop shops like this and will visit this place again and again. And the Baklava is a must have to top off your fabulous Greek fare :)

Wow!  I was in this part of town and needed a place to eat.  Yelp came through again.  Super friendly owner and the moussaka was amazing.  The Greek salad was also insanely good.  They also have some unique items, such as herb pita bread - pita bread stuffed with a mixture of herbs.  Very tasty.  Their tzatziki was kind of bland, but everything else was amazing.

Tzatziki is sour cream instead of plain Greek yogurt, and not flavorful enough for my liking, but that is more than forgiven by virtue of the moussaka. You can smell it as it arrives to the table! Delicious! Gyro meat is more flavorful than what I've had most places. Small soda fountain available (Coke, Diet Coke, Minute Maid lemonade, Barq's Root Beer). There's also a small selection of imported products (juice, tea, ground coffee). Will have to come back for Greek coffee (there's also Turkish available) and baklava.

We ordered two gyros and a cup of lentil soup. We were the only two patrons in the restaurant and it took them 20min to bring our food out. The meat and soup are already prepared - all you have to do is put it on pita! It's not like you were busy ffs. Food was terribly mediocre, soup unappetizing altogether. The gyro meat was the only thing that tasted good.

Great service first off...authentic...cafe ambiance with Greek music...but for one woman...who is Greek and very nice...she cooks quickly!  Falafel crisp and hummus perfect! Got extra to go...also can buy goods at reasonable price...
Their fries and fry sauce are Amazing!!! Great little mom and pop shop definitely worth checking out! The owners are super friendly with great service and great food.

Wow, the other reviewers really aren't kidding when they say the owners of this restaurant are super nice and helpful! I'm no Mediterranean food connoisseur so it was kind of relieving when I walked in Baladie Cafe and wasn't pressured to order quickly or expected to know how to pronounce everything on the menu!

Anyway, I ordered my food to-go which it's recommended that you call ahead and place your order but since they don't have a copy of their menu online, first-time customers have to go in and order and wait. (They have paper menus you can take home with you). The wait isn't suspiciously fast by any means, it's just long enough for you to study the menu, read through your Facebook newsfeed and catch up on Words with Friends.

I got the Mediterranean platter ($8.99), the Greek Sampler platter (10.99), a side of seasoned fries ($1.60) and the lamb&beef shawerma ($5.50).

The Mediterranean platter is very flavorful and seems more like a healthy snack-plate or a small appetizer to share. It's a vegetarian platter that includes pita bread, hummus, babaghanouj (seasoned mashed eggplant), falafels (deep fried mashed chickpeas), dolmas (stuffed grape leaves), tabouli (finely chopped parsley, tomatoes, cucumbers and bulgar wheat), and a little lettuce, tomato, cucumber, pickle, olives and feta cheese off to the side.  I would definitely get this again!

The Greek Sampler platter is only $2 more than the Mediterranean platter but it seemed like so much more food! It includes pitas, a half-size of their Greek salad, spanakopita (like Baklava but bigger & made with spinach instead of honey and nuts), mousaka (cooked eggplant dish), gyro meat, tzatziki (cucumber yogurt sauce), dolmas (stuffed grape leaves), and tomato, olives and feta cheese on the side. I built my own little pita pockets with the gyro meat, tzatziki, tomato and feta, plus I added a bit of the tabouli from the Mediterranean plate. It was DELICIOUS! 

The seasoned fries were okay. They tasted homemade and sort of... healthy? I don't know. Some people may prefer these fries but I like the crispiness and saltiness of fast food fries too much to trade them in for Baladie's fries.

I didn't try the shawerma because it was for my husband and he ate it quickly, but he said it was delicious.

This place was great, the owners were sweet, the food was great. I will definitely be going back!

Dear Christie L, I hope you do realize that the new owners of this fine eating establishment have changed nothing about the resturaunt except more food for your dollar and about the tzatziki sauce, nothing has changed about it. The old owners bought that sauce they did not make it. The new owners are buying the exact same sauce so I have no idea what you're talking about. Stop being scared because new people own it, it's the exact same food. keep it up Baladie best medditeranian food in Vegas and nothing has changed.

Came here for lunch on a Monday. Staff was friendly and gave us some recommendations. We ordered the Mediterranean wings and a traditional gyro. Gyro was exceptionally good. Could have used a little more cucumber sauce, will get an additional side of it next time. Wings were cooked perfectly and the house Ranch dressing was perfect. Would recommend this restaurant. Will definitely be back.

After a long absence, I stopped back in to Baladie Cafe recently. This was one of my favorite spots in the Valley for Middle Eastern/Mediterranean food...while still good, it is not as amazing as it once was. 

Ownership has changed. Not necessarily a bad thing on its own. The service on my last visit was more than adequate, it was friendly and polite. The old owners, however, were special and engaging in a way that few people are capable of being.

They claimed to have maintained the recipes...that was certainly not the case for the Mint Tea, but the Gyro I enjoyed was still one of the better ones in town. I probably won't rush back, but I also certainly wouldn't avoid it either...though I'll pass on the Mint Tea.
Love the food and the cute couple that own it. They're so nice and friendly! Food is always tasty!

The pita bread must be frozen, and it tastes like it. I am used to the piping hot, fresh from the oven pitas served at Khoury's in the SW, so I was very disappointed with the gummy, bland, freezer burned taste of the pita at Baladie. The portions are small, even at about $8-$10 a person.

I had tasteless, unseasoned falafel, and hummus that was just as bland. Middle Eastern food is usually fragrant and delicious with exotic spices, but the food here is the exception. 

For a restaurant located in a strip mall, it sure is decorated like one-Shabby, no ambiance, not very clean. Boring, tasteless, food and no reason to return.
The Shawerma plate is some of the best I've had, the meat is just spiced so well. I'd highly recommend.

Was really excited to try this place after reading all the reviews. The lamb meat was good, but it only had a couple veggies and too much tzatziki sauce. Also, we went during lunch and it took way too long. The herb fries were pretty tasty.

I've been here probably 10 times or so. I can't bring myself to order anything besides the gyro platter, fries, & pistachio Balaclava but only because these things are so good. Plus the people that run this place are really kind & friendly. Definitely give this place a shot.

This was our first time here and we won't be coming back.  The food was very good, very tasty with great flavor, but the service was poor.  My mom and I arrived there around 7:15 p.m. last night, the lady there did not great us warmly at all.  She just stood there looking at us until we decided to place our order.  As a matter of fact it was clear that she didn't even want to do anything.  When she brought our food out she placed it on our table and we're looking like, "Where's the silverware"???  She didn't even tell us that we had to get up and get our own silverware, napkins, etc...  We everything against the wall near the beverage fountain.  She asked if everything was okay when we were almost done.  That was it!!  When we left she didn't say goodbye or thank you for coming.  She ran up to the door and locked it as soon as we left!!  The energy was bad in this place, we won't be coming back.  The only reason why I gave you 3 stars is because the food was good.  I've noticed that you've had other complaints about the service before.  Seems like you should really hire people that actually enjoy working in the food/beverage business.  I'm also guessing that you don't have a lot of dine in customers, that's why there isn't a restroom there?  There's seating for 25.....

You have got to be kidding me! I went here hoping that it would be awesome Mediterranean food. I love to support small businesses and I love Mediterranean food. I ordered a lamb & beef gyro for my wife & a spanakopita platter for me. My wife says the gyro tasted good but it barely had any meat. The spanakopita was a HUGE disappointment. It was the spanakopita triangles that you can buy at Costco. Unreal! If you claim to be a Mediterranean restaurant, you'd better get someone in that kitchen that can make one of the most basic (yet tasty) Greek items of all time. This was unacceptable. We won't be back to this place.

I love this place!  The owners are very nice and great chefs.  

It doesn't look like much from the outside (it's in a strip mall), but the food is delicious.  I'm a big fan of the gyro platter.

This place is so close to my work and amazing! Not a bad price either. 

I always get the lamb gyro wrap. I love it the lamb is so tender! I love the seasoned herb fries as well. They have a unique taste I swear I could eat them all day everyday. 

The couple that owns this are so sweet and act like we are in their home. It doesn't feel like a restaurant, more like a friends house. :)

Check out this cafe it's worth going to

I come here often and the food is always amazing.  Try the lamb and beef gyros (spicy) or the rotisserie chicken.  You will not be disappointed.  Also best tzatziki sauce I have ever had. The owners always remember you after your first visit and see always happy to see you again.

@ Lawrence C -  It has been almost two years now since my husband and I have been coming to baladi café  We love and appreciate this amazing food prepared by a lovely woman and served by the most gracious people One could meet .  You are obviously a pawn  that works for the restaurant you mentioned at the end of your post . Since you just opened your Yelp account a few days ago.   How sad that you would conjure up such a lie about two lovely people who own a wonderful restaurant.  You are whats wrong  within the human race. Grow a conscious Beast!

Baladie Cafe is a diamond in the rough, a true winner in a neighborhood that generally suffers from a lack of great cuisine.  Thanks to Jade and my trusted Yelpers for finding this spot.  It's fairly close to my work, and I can't believe I have found it just recently.

I have been twice so far, and each time has gotten better.  First time around I had the Greek Platter, which is a fun sampler of a few different Greek foods.  The pita bread can be separated into a pocket for stuffing your samples.  I enjoyed every bit of it!  The second visit I had the Shawerma wrap with added feta cheese and seasoned french fries, ordered spicy of course.  The wrap comes with a thicker pita bread, pre-wrapped with goodness.   It is basically like a gyro, but with hummus instead of Tzatziki sauce.  I have to say, the hummus is friggin killer here.  I much prefer it over the Tzatziki sauce.  In fact, if I were to find one thing that isn't five star about this place, it would be the Tzatziki sauce.  It is just a little bland to me.  

The service is friendly and casual.  This family owned business aims to please.  When we went today with some coworkers, we brought our "meat and potatoes" coworker (basically he has the pallet of a 5 year old).  The owner heard us teasing him as we always do, and when he came to our table to ask if everything was good, he joked, "I'm asking him, not you!" He already knows I'm a huge fan, and his concern was to please even the pickiest eater!
Best Mediterranean food I've had in North Las Vegas love the Gyros and Baklava with mom and dad

This restaurant is very mediocre. There were only 3 other customers in the restaurant who already ordered. However, it took 30 minutes to get our dinner out to us. There was also bad service by one of them when bringing out the food. One of the cooks or just a friend of the owner's kid brought out the food but didn't even think about bringing silverware out. I had to ask them for that and a cutting knife due to the lamb having not been cooked tender or marinated. Overall, the food was ok but the service by this family owned restaurant needs to significantly improve. I don't think I'll go here again soon.
I had the best dinner last night at baladi cafe, the food was so delicious and the service was good. Very friendly family place
I met new owner. Pleasant. The food fresh and delicious. Highly Recommend this experience. Cindy

The food is delicious! The owners are super sweet. I had the chicken pita, my husband had the lamb. Whatever that sauce is they serve with the fries is very tasty too. Can't wait to go back and try other items on the menu!

After seeing all the great reviews, I had to give it a try.  The owners certainly are lovely people, but I was underwhelmed with the food.  My lunch companion had the sampler plate, and mowed through it pretty well, so it must have been good.  I had the spanakopita, and it was very disappointing.  I made better at home on my first attempt.  Rather than being painstakingly layered, it was just several layers of phyllo stuffed with a spinach filling.  A sad imitation of the masterpiece that they serve at Sultan's Grill in Village Center in Summerlin.  I'm glad that others had a more positive experience, but I don't think I'll go back.  Spanakopita is the litmus test for me, and it failed badly.

Very disappointed with my most recent experience here. Have been in before and the gentleman that helped us was very friendly and the food was wonderful. Went in Monday evening around 6 and the service was terrible. The young lady at the counter seemed irritated from the moment my family walked in the door. The restaurant was empty when we walked in, we ordered and waited about 30 minutes for our food. When we checked we were missing a wrap and had received the wrong salad. We were then told that it would be another 20-25 minutes because there were now 4 other orders ahead of us. She had a terrible attitude and behaved as if it was our fault that there were issues with the order. Even just a small apology and a less accusatory tone would have gone a long way towards making this a better experience. When we got home with our food we discovered the baklava and the pitas were stale and the portions on one of the platters were smaller than what was in the wrap. We definitely would have chosen a different restaurant if I knew we would have to wait an hour with my 1-year-old son for mediocre food.
fantastic, and such nice owners!!!

Four stars for the food! At least the falafel combo I had. The service was more like 1 or 2 star experience.  I won't fault them for that because they were noticeably shorthanded. They had what appeared to be the owner of restaurant as the order taker, cashier, server, cook, and dishwasher. The help arrived late and lunch time hit unexpectedly. The owner still handled everything friendly and professional manner.

The falafel was served on a long flat pita wrap, with LTO, hummus and Tahini sauce. I had them add a spicy chili sauce which I most likely will not have again.  The flavor just did not blend well with fresh falafel.  

The have a decent selection of menu choices here. From plates and wraps to salads and desserts. They have a delicious mint tea that they make fresh daily. Definitely a recommendation. 

Small business will continue to struggle in NV unless we unite and visit local places in our own neighborhood. Amazon style business model will continue to grow which is convenient but impersonal.  Only you can make a difference one visit at a time.
Good gyros..more authentic then gyrotime by far... try the gyro fries. friendly staff..should be open on sundays though!

Let me tell you about amazing service!!! Drove over to pick up order but she had not gotten it from Yelp so I showed her the receipt and she made the food in amazing time !!! Kat provided 10 star customer service and even made me a yummy cup of Turkish coffee to boot!!! This was our first time here but we will now be regular customers!!! So excited to find yummy Greek food with amazing service!!! Thank you so much Kat!!!

Been here a few times now and I love it! The food is amazing. I especially love getting the Greek sampler and the pistachio baklava. Will continue to come here anytime I'm craving Greek (which is very often).

I hate to give this place a mediocre review since it's so highly recommended on yelp, but there were some problems with our meal so I'll give it 3 Stars with the hope that maybe we did dine at BC on an off day.

-Scwherma platter with chicken: the pita bread was TOUGH. It was hard to tear, let alone chew. Wasn't fresh, was probably sitting out for a day or two. Also, the chicken was ok. Looked like something just thrown in the oven and baked. No color, not grilled, not much flavor, just plain, but atleast it wasn't dry. 

-Gyro wrap: They should call this a veggie wrap with some lamb. Overloaded with cucumbers and tomatoes to hide the fact that there was hardly any meat inside. Very disappointing. However, the spicy sauce was pretty good and the pita bread used for the wrap was much better. Soft like what pita bread should be. 

-Herb fries: awesome! French fries covered in herbs. Best part of the meal. But I wouldn't come back just for the fries. 

The owners were extremely nice and I almost feel guilty that I didn't like the food, but I've had better Greek food so I probably won't be back.

Yelp was totally correct on this one. Had Mediterranean platter. Not a vegetarian myself, but the humus and eggplant spread just called my name. It also had tabouli salad, falafel, and riced stuffed grape leaves. It was a great portion for less than $10. The mint tea was amazing. My husband had the gyro wrap with fries. The spicy sauce, on the wrap was great not too spicy but added a lot of flavor.  The fries were hot, crispy, and had a great seasoning. The place is small but it feels like you walked in to the owners home. The owners made sure we were happy, well fed, and personable. He even kid with me about not wanting the spicy sauce on mine but loving the bite my husband let me try of his wrap.  We live on the totally other side of town, but will definitely be making the trip for this food and service again.
A cozy and local place to have authentic Mediterranean food! Affordable and delicious eats. This place should have more exposure and check ins!

You walk in the door and are greeted with a smile. That is a rarity here in Vegas!  The smell of gyros waft through the modest little cafe.  The gyro fries look fabulous and better yet taste fabulous! This is a fabulous place to grab Mediterranean cuisine!

We just finished trashing the gyro wraps and fries from Baladie Cafe.  So disappointing!  The meat was so dry it crunched, the pita was so dry if fell apart and the fries were so salty they were inedible.  This was a huge waste of $30.00.  Never again. If I could have given 0 stars, I would have.

So I've been coming here for many years, and even drove across town to eat here.   I moved back on this side of town and get here more often, and I stopped in today.  The nice older couple who owned it are no longer there, which is fine.  The new couple is very nice, but the food I think needs a little work.  The meat in my wrap was very overdone and chewy, and there wasn't a lot of it.  There was a lot of yummy garlicky hummus, but the veggies were missing a lot too.  The other owners always served it with extra onions tomatoes and I think pickles.  It arrived plain on a plate.  The lentil soup that I always get was barely lukewarm, but tasted the same as before minus maybe cumin??  I still ate everything because I was starving, but I hope the new owners take this criticism to heart, because I recommend this place to everyone, and I would hate to take those recommendations back.
This place gets great reviews so I stopped in. The customer service is amazing and I haven't even ordered yet! 3 regulars walked in and he already knew what they wanted!

I was the only person eating in at Baladie a few days ago, and not only got a great gyro bowl, but had a great time chatting with their friendly staff. The cafe reminds me of the hole-in-the-wall restaurants of the Bay Area. Once I saw the large portion size I was convinced I'd get two meals out of it... but then I realized how good it was. Nope.

Are you kidding me? This place is awesome !! The service is great and the owners are very nice . The food is authentic Mediterranean . I had the lamb and beef gyros, out of this world. The perfect blend of spices on the meat was savory goodness. My wife had the Mediterranean , everything was excellent . One must try this wonderful place and for us it will be a regular !

A nice hole in the wall in a strip mall. Very good food very natural. Ricky and his wife the owners are very sweet people they take a lot of pride in their preparation and serving of food. Great place.
The owners of this place are awesome. They treat you like family. Best gryos in town. Salads and hummus are great too! Everything is made fresh.

I hate to give these guys a bad review but the 5 stars is a bit over rated. The prices were reasonable but the food was just so-so. I think the ratings may be high because they offer a free dessert with a Yelp review or check in.  Family run business with friendly service. No bathroom for customers. Food came out relatively fast.

I love this place! It's literally 5 minutes from my house and I frequently go during lunch time. The pita is soft and fresh, the lamb is tasty, and the food in general is great!
Only downside is there are only about 6 tables available and during lunch hours they are usually all occupied.

Got the Greek sampler. And they have an option of making it spicy, so spicy it is. 
The dolma is pretty good, as is the gyro meat/pitas, it also came with a moussaka but that wasn't tasty/ too burnt. The Spanakopita was tasty with flakey crust. It also came with a side salad but there was wayyyy too much dressing on it, kinda making it really greasy. Overall good price and decent food.

Top in everything , YUMMMY Food, healthy, reasonable prices, great management & owners, friendly staff, clean environment, i will go back again & again & again , you gotta try it,   make sure you ask for the fries, never tasted better fries anywhere else !! mouth watering flavors, herbs, spices & lots of yumminess
This Family Run eatery is exceptional. We always get their gyro with a single order of their seasoned fries. This is not Fast Food. It is food worth waiting for. The experience feels like home.

Warm Gyros on a rainy day in North Las Vegas...hell yeah! I don't know much about Mediterranean cuisine...but I enjoyed lunch at Baladie cafe immensely.

I arrived earlier than my love... restaurant was empty. The gentleman who was serving and cooking alone was kind and attentive.

We ordered a Gyros "Yee-rows": lamb & beef includes hummus, tomato, cucumber & lettus with spicy sauce added. We also ordered the Greek Sampler: Half Greek Salad (the hugest half I've ever gotten), Spanakopita, Moussaka, Gyros Meat, Tzatziki Sauce, Dolmas, Tomato, Feta Cheese, Kalamata Olives and Pita. Additionally, we ordered a side of hummus and two mint teas.  I didn't enjoy mint tea but the hummus was so good we ordered a to go 1/2 Pint hummus for $3.99...and asked for it spicy.

Gyros was my favorite...I knew we were sharing the order, but I just kept biting into it.  The Greek Sampler was good also, just not quite as good, and was also too much to explore...maybe that's why it's called "Sampler".

It's little long drive for me to get to the Baladie Cafe but I will remember to stop here for Gyros and very friendly service  whenever I'm in the area.

This is absolutely not a place to go! Although it took a long time to prepare my wood, but My meal was not cooked well and was I bel to eat the raw meat! Also the food portion was relatively small and it was over priced! The restaurant is not also quite clean, using the restroom you will need to go to the kitchen! Not sure why they are still in business, but it might be because of original couples were running the place.

Like the others who gave this restaurant 3 stars, I'm sorry to do it. The service was great, and the owners so sweet, but the food is only so-so. The mezze was good. I enjoyed the hummus, baba ganoush, falafel and tabbouleh. Unfortunately, the chicken gyro left a lot to be desired. The chicken looked and tasted as if it had been baked a day or two ahead of our visit. Tough, colorless and flavorless. And the pitas weren't homemade or fresh. I probably won't be giving them another try.

This was good back when an older couple owned it.! They sold it to "these" people.  Rude on the phone.  Hardly any meat in the food.  Hardly any spices on the fries.  The Baklava was even a little dry.  I don't recommend at all.  I would give it no stars but this App won't let me.

I have been coming here off and on for the past couple of years. For a quick filling bite, the wraps are best to order. The falafels are pretty tasty as well, and can be requested to be made spicy. I've had more items from their menu, but we mostly go for the gyros or the shawarmas! 

The ambience is adequate since most are just going in to get the quick bite to go, just wish they would expand into a bigger place (maybe a little closer to the 215/decatur area - please?)! Owners are very friendly and will recognize you after a few visits (if not by name, definitely by face)! So that's a plus! They are very friendly towards children to. The one time I had my daughter (she was a little over 2) sit down to eat, the owners brought ought a couple of extra goodies without extra charges.

The bonus is that this location is next to the Ace Hardware store which has a lot of Hawaiian snack goodies we like to get.

I'll be back here soon!

We were very impressed with the quality of food and the good prices. We ordered the Mediterranean and shawerma plates and we were not disappointed. The owner suggested we try the food spicy. The babaghanouj was pleasantly spicy but not overbearing.  I am not a big fan of lamb but I tried a bite of my husband's shawerma (beef and lamb) and it was phenomenal.  Everything was delicious.  The owner was very friendly and helpful.  We would definitely return.

amazing home made greek food
the hummus is amazing along with the gyro and backlava
def a nice hidden little gem out here in the vegas desert
The owners were very excited that we had come in! they made it easy and had great recommendations. One of the best gyros ive ever eaten with a nice side of mint ice tea!

Came for lunch. The chicken and lamb shawerma platters were delicious. The meats were high quality and the sides of cucumber, tomatoes, feta and hummus were tasty and very fresh. The Mediterranean spiced fries were made with fresh potatoes, not frozen and the spices on it made it very special.

Honestly I will never come back. I should have got a refund for the poor service I received. I came with my coworkers on our lunch break and after waiting 45 minutes and having to watch everyone else at my table eat I finally had to tell them to just wrap mine up to go.
