They should have offered me a refund instead of giving me attitude. The cashier was unbelievably rude to me. The other new girl was pleasant and I could tell she was sorry. The wrap they gave me to go was not good there was too much sauce and I can tell they just threw it together. So thank you for ruining my lunch and making me pay 13 dollars for it. The owner apologized but if I was her to save my business I would have offered apologies instead of the excuse that her staff was all new. Customer service should be your top priority you let me as well as my coworkers leave knowing that we were far from pleased with our experience here.

Absolutely fantastic food at a great price.  Wonderfully helpful and kind people who know how to make awesome, authentic med food.  Such a cool and neat little place!!  They can even cater events... we recently had them cater for my office and they went way above and beyond what we needed....and the price was right!  Can't beat this place!

I love finding a place like this around the corner from my house... What a lovely family-run business.. Everything I have tried here has been a delight!! I dream of the fries & secret sauce.. I ate my husbands leftover tetziki sauce.. By the spoon..

I stumbled in here one afternoon with my mom after a brief yelp search for food and I'm so glad we ended up at Baladie! The prices weren't fast food low but they were appropriate for the quality and amount of food served. I got a salad with chicken and my mom got some kind of platter. We both tried and failed to consume everything we were served. Tea was great, as was the food. If you love Mediterranean food as much as I do then this place is worth a visit if you're in the area.

Love this place. The food is delicious and made fresh to order. Hard-working family owned business. Would patronize this place often if I was a local. The falafel was the best I ever had. The seasoned fries with the homemade sauce were a nice surprise. The lamb gyros were yummy too. Highly recommend.

What a gem! This place was great. Great food (I got the greek platter and wife got the mediterranean platter), great price (only$ 24 for two including drinks), and the owners are very friendly and inviting (they make you feel like your business is truly appreciated). More establishments should be like Baladie. Glad we went out of our way to try this place after reading similarly glowing reviews on yelp. Opa!

A warm welcome and greeting when we came in. Very helpful and explained each variety of dinners for us so we could make out decision. We will be back, great service and delicious food choices, and so close to home, bonus for me!

There has been a change of ownership I the last year. I thought the first time I came after that change was going to be my last.

The food is as good if not better than before but that first time the service was awful. I was the only diner and it took almost 30 minutes for me to get my food. During the wait I could only imagine how poor it was going to be, where was the Baladie of old !?

Luckily the food was worth the wait. I vowed to give them another chance and have been back several times since and have not experienced anywhere close to a 30 minute wait.

Customer service could do with a little improvement. On more than one occasion I have seen a newbie come in and the menu is never explained in an inviting and exciting way. I hope they are not losing customers due to this, I'd hate to lose this, one of my favorite little lunch spots.
Amazing food and the owner is super friendly!!! Great quality food!!! By far the best Mediterranean food in town.
Great little family run Mediterranean place. The couple running this place are awesome, and the food is delicious. Try the bagels for breakfast. Prices are very low for the quality, this is a gem GO!

I have found a new favorite spot. The food here is absolutely delicious and fresh, the best I've had yet!  We get ours on the spicy side and the lamb is perfect. The owners, husband and wife, could not be any sweeter or more welcoming. They are appreciative and accommodating, the kind of place that I like to spend my money at! My boyfriend and I come around lunch time and dine in, it's a nice-quiet lunch setting and a clean café. Absolutely wonderful. They deserve all the business they can get.

Dropped by to try this spot for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  Service was quick and friendly.  Food tasted really good!  We ordered herb fries, a lamb & beef gyro, and a lamb & beef shawarma.  Will be back to try smoothies and chicken wings!

I must have came on a slow day. The cashier cook were the same. Tuesday night. I ordered at 6:13 and still did not receive my meal. It's now 7pm. Sorry yelpers wish I could say something different. This is ridiculous. And get this, there was only one couple in front of me.

Baladie Cafe lives up to the reviews!  This Mediterranean place is run by a cute couple who have been at this location for 8 years.  They serve delicious gyros, kabobs, and baklava for a reasonable price.  The owner is also super nice and friendly with his customers.  I am so happy to have tried this gem in the vast empty landscape of North Vegas.

I got the chicken schwarma plate ($7.99) which comes with 4 pita halves, veggies, and hummus.  The chicken was flavorful and moist.  When everything is put together in the pita with the hummus I went to food heaven for a little bit haha.  So good.  

My roommate got the lamb gyro plate which was also delish.  The lamb was flavored well without being too salty or dry.  This plate comes with yogurt tzatziki instead of hummus.  

The plates don't look like a lot of food but it does fill you up!  I was really impressed that I got so full!  (I have a big appetite).  After the food settled down we had to try their baklava and rice pudding for dessert.  Go big or go home.

The baklava comes in two flavors walnut and pistachio.  We both liked the walnut more.  It was a little more sweet than the pistachio. Overall both are delicious and have a yummy flaky crust that is hard to beat, but the flavor of the walnut is more of a dessert flavor to me.  The rice pudding was nice to wash the baklava down with.  It wasn't too sweet and it is served cold.  

I am definitely coming back to Baladie Cafe!  Can't wait to bring other people here to try their delicious healthy food.
This food is to die for,best gyro.we ordered the #5 ,meat is amazing... OMG The baklava,friendly service highly recommend

I'm so sad. I loved this place. We used to love the hummus and tabouli!
I moved from the area awhile ago so when I found myself in the same neck of the woods today I was excited to get some again! Alas I didn't realize that ownership had changed.  
Tabbouli was old, must have been made days ago. And the container was only half filled. Hummus was overloaded with lemon yet somehow tasteless, and I detect that it is being diluted with something. Can't put my finger on it, but there is definitely "another" flavor in there that I don't recognize. Maybe white beans. (?)
Pita bread was clearly reheated old bread. Some cut up pieces and some not. Strange. Obvious when old bread is heated because it immediately turns rubbery and hard as it cools. Looked like they threw someone's leftovers into our bag. Sadly I will not be back.  sigh

I don't know how good this place was when it was under the old management but it had to be out of this world cause this place is amazing. Awesome gyro, fast/attentive service and my wife and I couldn't stop munching on our basket of seasoned fries. Definitely coming back.

Agree with the other posts that this little business is nothing to look at but the food is amazing.  Everything was cooked to order for us.  I had the Mediterranean Plate and my husband had the Chicken Shawarma and we were both pleasantly surprised.  The food is very fresh and the falafel were wonderful.  The owners were very kind too.  We will definitely be back.

I was next door at Ace Hardware and cold not resist the urge for baba ganoush and tabouli, so I stopped in to get some to bring back home.  These two items are usually my barometers for a Mediterranean joint. The owners are wonderful and very friendly - and so I really wanted to like to food better. The baba ganoush was good, but not great, and the tabouli was just edible.  The diet coke was flat.

I hope I have a chance to come back, because I really want to like this place more.  Next time I'll sit and stay, and order a real meal.

I LOVE this place. I just recently found them on Eat24. Great food and great service! The owners are so nice and remember your name! I could eat the dolmas, greek salad and baklava forever! Very good and authentic food. They deliver now too! Highly recommend!

I am so glad to have found this place on Yelp! There is a lack of quality food options near my home so I'm glad that I stopped in to try something in my backyard instead of driving across the valley like I mostly have to do. 

I tried a Greek salad 4.5/5, lamb and beef gyro 5/5, seasoned fries 5/5 and a walnut baklava 5/5. I thought with all this food I should stretch it in to two meals but it was so good I ended up eating it all in one sitting. My stomach is a bit peeved at me but man am I content. 

I liked that the salad included a dolmades, I knocked a bit off my salad rating as it had a bit too much dressing I may ask for it on the side next time. Also I didn't care for the pita flat bread with seasoning inside. Otherwise I really enjoyed the salad. 

The fries were just perfect and I loved the seasoning. 

The main attraction, my gyro was without a doubt one of the best I've had. The meat was plentiful and perfectly seasoned. I liked the little touch of sauce included. 

One last note, the owners were very kind. It is a breath of fresh air when an owner takes pride in their work and makes you feel welcome. Most places in my area treat you like a bother or just ignore you. So top marks to a place where they greet you and make your day just by going the extra mile!

Excellent service and the food is always amazing!

It's better to call ahead.  The restaurant is kind of small.

I love their baba ghanoush, but I have a hard time ordering anything other than a gyro because it's just so delicious!  The rice pudding is also amazing.

Second time visiting.

Before i can even eat their food i am humbled by the hospitality i received from the owners. Good people that make great food. 

I had their shawarma both times in addition to their new Mediterranean seasoned chicken fingers and fries. Which were delicious.

I highly recommend anyone to go and dine there. Support this local business. If for nothing else, go for the fries!!!

My husband and I visited the café after noticing the sign. We were so delighted that there was a Mediterranean café close to us. 

The café was clean and had an intimate setting. The employees warmly welcomed us and provided menus answering dietary questions.  I'm a vegan and there are vegan menu items. What's not to love? They offer Greek coffee too.

My husband was impressed with the flavor and presentation of his lamb/beef gyro. The fries were to die for and the seasoning was superb. I ordered falafel and fries plus a drink. There is a special for $9.99 for a hefty drink, gyro sandwich and a plate full of seasoned fries. There is a fry sauce that is served with the fries.

My husband also ordered baklava and really liked it with his hot tea. I purchased a jar of Cortas imported fig jam from Lebanon. It was delicious when I sampled it the next day on toast. We also ordered lentil soup to go for later and it was a refreshing twist on a favorite classic. There were lentils, shredded carrots and spices in a generously filled Styrofoam bowl. There was plenty to share.

There is catering available in addition to dessert platters for any occasion.  The prices are reasonable for all menu items.

I told my husband that I wanted to visit for my birthday.  We usually eat at The Mint Indian buffet but it is so far away.

Lastly I would like to add that you can tell a lot of work and care goes into their food preparation.
The staff was very friendly and helpful o providing suggestions for our first time at this restaurant. The food was delicious and had minimal wait time. A lovely lunch!

I stopped in for lunch the other day and was really disappointed. The nice older couple who ran Baladie Café for years were no longer there and the girl behind the counter told me that there are new owners now and they were given the recipes previously used and were trying to make everything the same. My food tasted nothing like I experienced before at Baladie Café. The girl working I have to say was very polite and nice. I have no complaints with her service at all. Inside however was really dirty and had a funky smell. After I placed my order and sat down to wait for it, a guy walked in and after looking at the menu and asking questions about why the prices had gone up and mentioning that the dining area could use some cleaning he decided to walk out and not place an order. I began to feel nervous about my order, but just hoped for the best. 

Veggie Gyro ($6.99) - The pita didn't taste fresh and was sort of dry. Inside the veggies were pathetic! Before the gyros were long and skinny, but they still had a decent amount of fillings and this one was a joke! I have never seen such a flat gyro. I know I got a veggie and not meat gyro, but before they still stuffed it with plenty of fresh veggies. This time the cucumbers were shaved paper thin and I had only one of those thin cukes inside. The tomatoes were mushy and some of it was just thin pieces of tomato skin. I had to pay an extra .99 cents for feta cheese that was only put on half of the gyro and had a taste to it that wasn't right. I don't think a lot of what was used was fresh at all. The tzatziki sauce tasted like really bland yogurt or sour cream and it was a terrible, terrible, terrible pass for tzatziki sauce. After 2 bites I was done.

Seasoned Fries ($1.99) - Yuck! They were so oily and the seasoning was just way too much. 

Gyros Platter ($9.99) - Lamb and beef, tomatoes, lettuce, cucumbers, tzatziki sauce and 2 pitas. Well, that's what you are supposed yo get! We only got 1 pita (dry and not fresh), 2 of those thin cucumber shavings, tomato shavings, lettuce and tzatziki sauce. The tzatziki sauce was the same as on the gyro and tasted bland and like yogurt or sour cream. The veggies were sad looking and the gyro meat was way too salty. The meat was more like over seasoned beef jerky. 

Baklava ($2.25) - They should really stick to the old $1.75 a piece price tag because what I had this visit was rock hard and not fresh. A whole box now costs $12. I'm sad because I never had better baklava before than the baklava I had when the other owners were here. 

After seeing the inside so dirty and the poor of excuse of food they are putting out now here, I can't see returning.

What I had..
Lamb/Beef Gyro & Tropical Thunder Smoothie 
Rotisserie Chicken Platter

What I thought...
YUM YUM YUM YUMMY YUM YUM. The gryo was delish-I-OUS! For my ultra carnivores, you may want to double up on the meat as they give a conservative portion. The meat portion in the gyro was enough for me today, as I am trying to cut back calories (non diet me was like dang... I should gotten two, but my will power prevailed today lol)  First I love that I can order on my phone and pick it up. Second I adored that they didn't make my smoothie until I got there so it was fresh (I see the thoughtfulness!) and the smoothie was GR E A TTTTT , no......like really great!!! .  I usually order lunch and dinner together during my busy days, therefore I saved the chicken platter for dinner. I took some nibbles of the chicken platter and it was frickin' delicious too. My wallet loves this place too,  I got lunch and dinner for $20.52 total ( affordable! and no cooking today!). This place is A+, and will be going on my permanent lunch rotation schedule. A place where I can get gyros and smoothies, 2 of my favorite things,  made well together is happiness...
I had eaten here many times over the years and have been very happy! However, my food this time left a bit to be desired. I didn't receive my sauce for my gyro and the swarma plate was lacking.
The place  is hidden gem. The food was fresh and homemade. The owner was very nice and he came over our table and chatted with us a little.
Best falafel in Vegas! Was very satisfied with my first visit and I was very happy with the food and service!

I go to this place about once a month on average.  I love their gyros and the mom and pop customer service.  The seasoning on their fries is so good. The espresso machine is still not working! 

It doesn't have the ambiance of a place like Paymon's, but the food is so much better.
Had the Greek fries and both baclava. Fried were on point all the way up, gonna go back for those gyro fries.  The baclava was good, prefer the pistachios one.

This is a review that kinda got lost in the shuffle...Sadly, according to Christie L.'s more recent review, ownership has changed....(sad face) 

The couple that used to run the place gave some of the best service, as if you were dining in their home. You hardly come across places like these nowadays. We shared a sampler plate, Shawerma, and the owner's childhood favorite(He would say "Everybody gets Lentil, they're missing out on my favorite soup since I was a kid!"), Shorba Soup and Tea as our beverage of choice.

The sampler platter hit the spot as it had a great variety of flavors and textures going on, and the Shorba Soup was deliciously hearty without weighing you down. The owner also tempted us with dessert and of course, we went with two winners, the Baklava and Rice Pudding. Don't know how Baladie is now, but with new owners, I think I'll just hang on to that one memorable visit.  ALOHA!!!

Shaks Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  4

I spent two years on a mission in Athens and a little in Thessaloniki.  I rarely find Greek food I really like.

This is very good and it is a sweet little place.  little cafe.  Owners are fun with some Mediterranean personality.  Even in Greece, the food differs from shop to shop.  Excellent here.  Baklava to die for, Feta is  (soft and very delicious!).  Their fries with spices are EXCELLENT.  All was great!

Oh my heck! I ate here for the very first time yesterday and was absolutely enchanted by the experience. Initially, it is an intimate dining experience without any unnecessary trappings. The restaurant was quiet, clean and comfortable. The owners are, frankly, as charming as was the food. The food service was personal and prompt. They were very attentive to me. While enjoying the food, I observed several customers enter and interact with them and have the firm conviction they are this way to everyone. 

While the interpersonal dynamics alone would be enough to bring me here again, they paled in comparison to the taste of the food. 

I decided to try the Greek Sampler Plate to get an overview of what they did well. On the spur of the moment, I decided to go for a cup of the Shorba soup also. I was asked if I wanted it spicy and answered in the affirmative. 

The soup was incredible! Halfway through I was regretting not ordering a bowl of it. The "heat" was barely noticeable, but enough to accentuate the subtle nuance of the broth. I drained that cup just as the Greek salad was brought to the table. 

The salad was perfectly dressed. All the greens were covered in a perfectly light but flavorful dressing--not saturated in it. The salad was much bigger than I had anticipated and I was concerned about my ability to finish the rest of my meal. 

Nevertheless, I endured and am glad I did. The dolma was tasty, the potato-eggplant dish was divine, but the topper was the gyro meat which was the BEST I have ever tasted in my life! I told my wife I would swear off carne asada forever if I could guarantee a constant source of this meat. Alone or with Tzatziki sauce it was incredible. I knew I couldn't adequately explain to my wife how good this food was, so I decided to save some of it for her. Unfortunately, I just kept noshing on the meat until I had only a very little left. 

I will definitely be back here often. If you like good greek food at a very reasonable price. This is the place to go!
Love the food! Authentic and delicious. Very fresh and always with a smile, staff is very friendly.
Very good authentic Greek food. The Gyro platter is great, I could find no fault in any thing that we had here. Luckily it isn't far from our house because we will be going back very soon.
FANTASTIC! We went here on a whim and are so glad we did! The food is amazing but the people who work there make it an enjoyable experience as well! We go back to eat there at least once a week now.
Great place! Love the food! Very consistent... My family & I come here all the time. Just had gyros & amazing  pistachio Baklava!
I love this place! Small hole in the wall and a warm welcome with tasty eats is all I need. Get the babaghanouj!

I'm giving a one star because you have to give a star in order to give a review. But my family and I have been coming for years seriously years 8+yrs so Amira and her husband always welcomed us and treated us like family. This is my second time coming in since the change of management. I believe my parents have been in a handful more times. But extremely disappointed with the service. This girl behind the register was so rude even rolled her eyes several times never even greeted us. She even rolled her guys again when she brought out my food, didn't even say a word after I thanked her. Wow completely disgusted with the service.

First off all I have been eating at this restaurant for over 5 yrs and have never had a bad meal there.  These are my personal fav's the roasted chicken and greek salad dish easily big enough for 2 people, the fresh 2.99 humus? how can you go wrong.  Kind of sucks that our secret place is getting popular.

Went in for my usual Gyro with feta and fries. Even though owners have changed the food is still delicious and amazing! The fires are still seasoned perfectly and my Gryo was great. The new owners are friendly and seem very excited to own the place. I will definitely be back for more!!! Great place for some authentic Greek food.

Had the lamb & beef gyro & side of fries. 
Although, it was very tasty & well cooked. 
My 2 complaints would be: they need to clean up the storage items & make the place more presentable as a restaurant. 2nd, they don't put enough meat & feta (paid extra) in the gyros. Fries portion was also too small for price. Owner was very pleasant.

I moved to Vegas from Detroit about seven years ago, and one of the few things I miss is really good Greek and Mediterranean food. I've tired just about every Greek place I can find in this city, but I've been totally spoiled by Greektown and Dearborn's fantastic authentic Mediterranean cuisine. Everything I've found up to this point has ranged from "meh" to outright inedible.

Baladie Cafe, however, is the first (and only) place I've found in Vegas that really feels like a taste of home. The owners are very friendly, and it's got that great "hole-in-the wall" vibe that makes it feel like a real hidden gem. 

Their gyro meat is spectacularly seasoned, and I'm convinced that they're the only people within 300 miles that understand that "spanakopita" is not the Greek word for "cheap dog food." Best of all, their prices are so reasonable that Baladie Cafe doesn't need to be a rare treat. This is one lunch spot I'll be visiting a lot from now on.

If there were a lower rating, this place should get it.  I paid for 3 entrees. Cheap Ingedients =CHEAP FOOD.  The falaffel was not the yummy fried ball I am used to.  Instead, it resembled a low grade crude muffin.  The hummus was white and runny and again, made of inferior ingredients.  It should have tahini, lemon juice, and olive oil.   It seemed to be made of crap.   The place spent no time on salads,  just a crudely cut cucumber and radish.  The chicken was not roasted..instead it seemed to be a flaccid steamed version...tasteless.  The gyro meat was ok..but I saw no roasting spit so assume it was frozen food..  Middle Eastern people NEVER use Serrano peppers.  The owner wanted to give me some Sera chi sauce which I refused.  The ingredients are cheap and the food is an insult to any person from the Middle East.  I got Ripped Off and they laughed all the way to the bank.
Awesome food. Clean. Friendly. Family owned. Get the Turkish coffee and baklava.

We stopped here for lunch on a day off. Really good food and even better service. The restaurant was charming on the inside and was very very clean, even looking behind the counter. Impressive to see ownership and management take such pride in their cleaning service. We will definitely be back. 

The fries are spectacular by the way.

Delish!!!!!! Freshly made and friendly customer service. Been coming here for years. Back with the old owners and they became like family. Glad to see the new management and chefs keeping the recipes alive and continuing the great service. Lots of improvements and the food is still

Very disappointed. Seems the new owners are taking the cheap way out. Buying pitas at the 99 cent store, rotisserie chicken from Costco and tzatziki sauce seems either store bought or just made horribly. This place is over priced, dirty and a disgrace to the old owners. The lady is really nice but I see the husband needs to actually take criticism to better his business instead of threating people. We use to go here twice an month and spend 60-80 dollars. Now we are done. We were there 9 months ago and decided to give them another try but were even more disappointed this time. Dry chicken, funky tasting salad, bad tzatziki sauce, overseased fries and flat gyros. You guys need to step it up and take the place seriously, you have big shoes to fill.

I can get Mediterranean food anywhere! But the service I received was what I came for. From the minute we came in, we were greeted with smiles and they treated us like family. 

I love supporting local businesses and this is definitely the place to support! The food was good. Ordered the chicken kabob plate and the portion was huge. Chicken was a little dry but not enough to not eat it haha. Definitely will come back to try something new!

What a great experience. The owner is a very friendly and sociable person. He was very helpful in guiding us to different options and helping us figure out what we wanted to order. The food was very good. Gyros were well made and did not fall apart while eating them. He was very apologetic because the meat had crumbled and gave us a gyro's worth of extra meat. Went back and had the same great service and experience.  So glad to have a friendly place and great experience (unlike the awful experience at the Little Greek).

I went here the other day with m boyfriend we got the chicken platter and gyro platter. It was really good. The chicken was very juicy. The pita bread is amazing , it's my favorite flat pita bread . I will definitely be visiting this place again!

At first, you enter the shopping center where this place is located and immediately start to worry. The center itself looks worn down and tired.
As you enter The Baladie, again it looks tired and outdated, but the smell welcomes you with open arms! The owner sits at a table and is excited to serve you. He makes you feel as if you were friends who lost touch and were reunited!
I had the lamb and beef gyro, it was wrapped in foil and was probably the neatest gyro I've ever eaten! The owner says his wife is the cook and she cooks with love! 
Awwww!!!

Amazing service to match their amazing food! I love little "mom and pop" restaurants like this. 
I'll be back again!
Amazing, casual Greek spot with the freshest food and exceptional service! Have the chicken pita wrap!!!!
Great gyros especially with the spicy sauce added but the fries seem to be a touch better great place

I absolutely love this place. The gyros are great, the hummus is good, the sauce that comes with the greek fries is absolutely amazing (and he won't tell me whats in it!) ;)

I will be coming back here for a long time.

Had lunch here yesterday (9/13/12) after a friend of a friend recommended it.  I'll admit we had reservations as it is tucked into the corner of a strip mall that has seen better days and is rather small but let me tell you, location and size aside, this place is a gem!!!

My friend and I  both ordered the Gyros (her-chicken, mine was traditional).  The pita was so soft and tasted wonderful.  The meat was really good but it was the tzatsiki sauce that was pure magic!!!  I ordered a side of fries that also came with a different but super yummy sauce.  You must try the mint iced tea-it is perfect without any sweetener.

The owners were very friendly and gracious and you almost felt like you were in their home.  I was drooling over a roasted chicken platter that another table had ordered.  I'm anxious to try the Moussaka, the Spanakopita and the aforementioned chicken.  

I have a strong feeling this will be my Thursday lunch place!

July 13th 2015 - UPDATE. Recently the original owners of this establishment sold it and moved out of Vegas. And against a recommendation of a fellow Yelper I decided to try it under the new ownership rather than go to McDonald's. I ordered the gyro wrap with feta cheese (now an additional 99 cents btw) and spicy, seasoned fries. The young lady at the counter was very pleasant and could hold a conversation. 
At first glance you may think they're skimping on the meat, but this is not the case, they simply are using a bigger wrap then the size I'm accustomed too. As a presentation, they put all the tzatiki (sp?) on the open end of the wrap, but I'd prefer it equally dispensed in my gyro. The gyro meat  tasted okay but again I had the spicy sauce on it so it's been "tainted" with added flavor. The fries were exactly the same, recalling from memory. (There could be the problem..my memory) 
Overall I think they still have some kinks to workout and based on that I would come back in a month to see improvements if any.. I want this place to do well...

The new owners are nice.  They remodeled a bit and added a few things to the menu.  I liked the place before and that has not changed.  It's the same basic menu.  Price look similar.  There are a few additional menu choices like smoothies and chicken wings.  The salad is really good.  Everything is cooked to order.
After a second visit to this place I must say I was very pleased again. The lady who works there is super friendly and makes you feel very welcome. Definitely recommend this place.

I've been going to this restaurant for 4 years, and I can't say enough about it. It's not just that the food is awesome (best french fries ever) but the owners have remembered me every single time I come in. They remember what I usually order, and what my partner usually orders. I've only had a problem with food once (I didn't like my soup) and the owner replaced it happily for me. It's so rare for me in Las Vegas to be genuinely valued and treated nicely when I go out to eat, and I'd rather spend what little money I earn at this Mom & Pop restaurant than somewhere like Applebee's. When I walk in here, it's like visiting a friend's house. You must go! :)
Not the best, everything lacked basic seasoning, I've had better store bought humus, falafels were meh

What a nice find: a small business with delicious food and friendly service. Feels good to support them.  I don't go out of my way to eat lamb, but the lamb gyro was fantastic! Tasty mint tea was a good accompaniment.

I have eaten here in the past and loved it. Its one of my favorite lunch sots by work. Today I went in and the food was horrible.  The lamb was over cooked and looked liked jerky. I did not see the same older couple that are usually there so I wonder if they are under new management. I don't think I will eat there again. Time to find another Greek restaurant in the area.

Happy to find this little place when I was in Vegas. 
This is one of those little hole in the wall places where you can find excellent flavors.

I had their Mediterranean platter with a mix of hummus, baba, tabouli, dolmas, falafel, and more. It was a great lunch for one. 

I would definitely return.

My first and so far only time to Baladie Cafe was a good trial run.  I ordered thte Greek Platter that comes with lamb/beef gyro, tzatziki sauce, feta cheese, dolmas, kalamata olives, a small greek salad, spanikopita and mousaka.  It was the best way I knew to try everything I wanted.  A brilliant idea in my mind.  I was mostly pleased with the experience.  The dolmas were very good and very briney.  And thankfully the leaves were tender.  The last time I had dolmas from Whole Foods the leaves were so tough and woody.  The ones from Baladie were quite good.  I know where to go when I get a craving now.  The olives were spot on too.  On their own I don't have a problem with the kalamata olives containing a pit.  At least it is expected.  I did not appreciate that they were unpitted in the salad.  I almost broke a tooth.  I suppose I just need to be more careful in the future.  Moving onto the gyro I would have to say not bad but not wonderful.  The meat had more lamb flavor than what I am accustomed to.  That is not a problem though.  It really was quite good.  But in all honesty the meat was a little on the dry side.  And the pita was not all too fresh either.  It was also kind of dry and was served in a store bought pita package.  It could have been better.  Where Baladie really shined in my mind was with the mousaka and spanikopita.  I've had spanikopita other places before and really did not like it despite my love for spinach.  This was good and the pastry was ultra flakey.  Right on.  The mousaka I was surprised with.  I had never tried it before and did not know quite what to expect.  The eggplant, potato and meat combination of it was awesome.  It was rich and creamy and just plain good.  I'm kind of drooling right now just thinking of it.  I could easily make a meal out of mousaka as it is very heavy and filling.  Beyond the food service was great.  The older gentelman (owner?) was great.  He was very friendly and curious as to how I heard about them.  I told him Yelp led me there and he started telling me about how a lot of his customers mention Yelp and also Urban Spoon.  He was asking me about some of the other review sites like Trip Advisor but I showed some Yelp love and brought the conversation back around.  I'm not that familiar with the other sites anyhow.  He was a nice man and happy for me to be there.  I'll be back sometime.

I would have to say this is one of my favorite Mediterranean/Greek restaurants. We've visited twice so far and both times have been exceptional. He remembered us like we were everyday regulars. Always friendly! Always fast! Always delicious!

The hummus has got to be the best in town. I know when I start craving Greek food then we have to come here for the hummus. Great flavor and delicious warm pita bread. Everything we have had here was just fantastic. The gyros, the half chicken plate, the skewers, the salad... Mmm, Mmm, Mmmmmmm. Baklava available for your enjoyment, but I have yet to try it. The drool is dripping down my face right now... 

They have a great selection on the menu. I never know what I want next, but he is there to offer up suggestions and ask what I like. It's helpful when your an indecisive person (me). 

It's not the fanciest or most modern joint, but does it really matter when the food is outrageously amazing? No it doesn't. Get your butt down there and get your Greek on.

I'm giving B Cafe 3.5 stars

I've been to this joint over 10 times in the past 2 years and I'd say they have the best greek food in Vegas at the moment, but just wish they were closer to the center of town.

I'd like to start by saying that they have the best hummus in town aside from Paymon's. I've tried their lamb plate that comes with side of tomato, lettuce, cucumbers, yogurt sauce + pita. I've also tried their sides, such as falafel, rice, fries, and their baklava and it's all been deliciously tasty.

Basically every time I've been here no matter what I've ordered, I've never been disappointed. Everything is priced well and you can get a whole meal + drink for under $10.

The couple who own this joint are down to earth and hardworking and aim to please their customers. I highly recommend this joint to anyone looking for delicious homemade greek food.

We just moved nearby and are lucky to have found the Baladie Cafe'! It is authentic, delicious, and the prices are very reasonable.  We will defiantly become
Regulars here!
Outstanding that's all I can say!!! De~Lish!!!! You gotta try the seasoned fries...with the sauce and whatever else you get you can't go wrong! Hidden Gem!

Came here after movies at aliante because of the reviews.  Was a hole in the wall kind of place and only 2-3 people were working.  It is a great place for lunch- I had the veggie falafel and it definitely left me satisfied.  But ultimately, the fries were what got me- I would've been happy ordering a plate a fries instead of the falafel
I came here and ordered A huge Gyro and some of the best fries I've had in a long time. I really enjoyed this local gem.  The owner was also super nice

My wife and I decided to check this place out and we will never step foot into this place again.

We walk in the door to see the three employees sitting around eating.  They ignored the fact that we were there.  We looked around and the place wasn't clean and the employees looked dirty.  It was quite embarrassing.  

So we walk up to the counter and we are just standing there.  We're confused because 2 feet to the left of us, those three people are eating and having a conversation so we assumed they were customers instead of employees.  After standing there for far too long, one of the ladies at the table stood up and finally acknowledge that we were there almost 5 minutes later, but did she help us....nah.  She decided to sit back down and finish her conversation while we are just standing there. 

So once she's ready to take our order and her conversation is over, she finally goes behind the counter.  We looked at each other and left.  How are you going to have your employees sitting around having a conversation instead of helping guess.

The only good part about this place was that we left and ended up eating the best Gyro I've ever tasted at the Market Grille Cafe about 2 miles down the road.

Best Greek food in Las Vegas. I have been to this restaurant several times and it never has once disappointed. You have to try the lady fingers as a desert before you leave. They were so good we had to take some to go.

Just received delivery for party at work. All the food was delicious, and neatly packed. The baklava tasted like home made!! Special thank you to Paul, the manager, for ensuring our order was perfect!

Let me start off by saying I'm from San Diego visiting family & had a craving for a Gyro, looked on Yelp & found this place, got there about 12:45 & was greeted as soon as I came in. The gentleman at the cash register ( sorry I forgot his name) was wonderful, polite & helpful, the owner Tami was also there & she was super friendly. I ordered a Gyro combo with fries & a drink, $10.81 after tax. The food was wonderful & the mint tea she has is so refreshing. Is it Gourmet food, no but is it really good food, yes. Give them a try if you're in the area.
Very good well worth it . Very clean place and the lady was very friendly . Will definitely will be going back
Super friendly place and SHAWARMAS!!!  I haven't had shawarmas since I was in Kuwait and they are excellent at Baladie.  It's a great place that is close to the north end of town.
My first time having Mediterranean food and it is great! Portions are huge so I'll have leftovers. Price was good and the customer service is a 10 (:

Looking for memorable food then go to the Baladie Cafe. No only is the food yummy, the family that runs it couldn't be more nice. We hadn't been there in 6 months, due to not dinning out as much and we were called by our first names. The gyros with fries are a must, but be sure to try the dolmas and homemade baklava. You will not be disappointed.

Gave this place a shot a couple weeks ago since I had a craving for lamb. The reviews made this place sound very good so why not. It's not too far from home. When I got there the owner greeted me and made me feel at home. He answered all my questions I had about the menu-- since I don't eat beef and pork. He was patient with me while I made me choices. He and his wife were very polite. The food was AMAZING!!! I ended up going again within a couple days to get dinner for my family and I. The food is great, customer service is excellent. If you like lamb definitely give this place a shot!! It's amazing.

As soon as i walked in, the smell of bleach was overpowering and that i had a coughing spell.  I ordered a greek salad, and the dressing was almost all vinegar, lamb on the salad was stale and dry.  Pita bread with the salad seems like days old and reheated in microwave. Very disappointing experience :(

A wonderful mom-and-pop joint tucked away in the corner of an almost-dead strip mall. The Greek food here is pretty good. I went with the standard gyro and was not disappointed. Support small business and check this place out.

Absolutely delicious beef & lamb gyro. Get it spicy, with feta cheese, and you won't be disappointed.

The staff of this smoke-free restaurant is friendly, and interested in talking about the menu.

Looking for that amazing little Medditerranean hole-in-the wall that everyone should definitely know about? Then Baladie Cafe is it! They have a big selection on their menu that includes items from NY deli style bagels to authentic Green dolmas (that are a way better deal than the dolmas you find at Whole Foods). 

The best part is that you are greeted directly by the owners who are an amazingly nice couple that truly do appreciate their customers. I had the Lamb and Beef Shwarma easy spicy with red onions. Loaded with hummus and lamb and beef, this wrap is amazing and a great portion. The pita is so soft and delicious. My fiance got the Lamb and Beef Gyro (which I got a laugh at the phonetic spelling they had to include on the menu) with feta which also is pretty sizable. You can taste the tzatiki and the feta and all the ingredients with each bite. We also got an order of the herb fries which comes with an amazing herb sauce. 

The food is delicious at a great price. You can call ahead for faster orders. I am definitely trying the dolmas and baklava and spanikopita the next time (and there will definitely be a next time and bringing friends). I just want to try everything!
Absolutely delicious, homemade Greek food, and the owners are wonderful! They even have several vegetarian dishes on the menu.

This place is so insanely good. I usually get the lamb/beef gyro plate and it is phenomenal. The meat is seasoned perfectly and the tzatziki sauce is the best I've ever had. The Greek sampler and lamb kabobs are also amazing. Basically everything at the restaurant is perfect! 

Now for the customer service. This place is run by a man and his wife and that's all I've ever seen in there. They are extremely warm and welcoming and are always happy to see us. They make you feel right at home each and every time you are in there. 

So to sum it up, this is as close to a perfect restaurant that you can get, the shopping center it is in is run down and half abandoned but who cares with food and service that is unmatched!

I wanted to love this place, but it's just dirty and gross. Food is not fresh and establishment is dirty. Also buyer beware, the owner gives out free dessert for a good review on Yelp! I wouldn't trust the reviews! I wish I didn't! Sorry but have to by honest.

We are in the process of moving to our new home in North Las Vegas and found this great little Greek Cafe in our neighborhood. The owner is a true Gentleman! Loved the refreshing unsweetened mint tea, the tasty chicken gyro, and the fantastic baklava made with pistachios. Our only minor complaint is that it is closed on Sunday when folks are looking for an eatery after church.

This is usually one of our favorite spots to eat.  Today however, the staff was not the same.  my wife was served by two women one we have never seen before.  

She ordered two plates and two fries as well as two pistachio baklava.  My wife asked to split the difference between cash and card and the lady looked at her like she had three heads.  Asked the other girl to help with payment.  Once she paid and they packed the bags she took them and returned to the car.  She then realized they forgot to give her one of the fries and the two pieces of baklava.  She returned to the restaurant to get the rest of the order.  They said that they forgot to give her the baklava.  My wife let them know that they forgot the other fry too.  The lady said that she only ordered one fry but that was not the case.  They told her that she would have to pay again for them.  Since they don't have itemized receipts she couldn't prove them wrong.  Since she used her cash on the first order she needed to use her card.  They said that they would have to raise the price of the fry in order to use her card.  Ridiculous.  

We were given a decent amount of Swarma but only a tiny bit of chicken.  Our total order was $28 for barely enough food for one.  We will not be coming here again.  If the owner is not there do not come here.  Bad service is bad for business.

Great little place, got takeout just now. 

I got the sampler and a two meat gyro to test it out.   It was all great.    

The sampler was decent sized and the salad was fresh. 

The gyro was good also. 

I don't know what the deal was with some of the bad reviews but I have no complaints.  I am going to check out other Mediterranean places but this place is decent.  

I will be back.

Delicious Greek/Mediterranean food!  Their food tastes extremely fresh and homemade. I got the #1 veggie platter and loved it. Great falafel and everything that comes with it. (And it's a lot of food.) The employees were extremely friendly and welcoming to me and everyone else who walked in while I ate there. Also their walnut baklava was PERFECT. I should have bought 10 pieces, lol. Two thumbs up for this place.
Awesome little cafe. The married couple who owns/serve this place are both nice. Love the chicken kabob and lamb gyro. Definitely worth trying

If I could give them 10 stars, I would!
I was craving a falafel and we had seen this place when we were in the area a few days before. So my husband took me there for lunch.
AWESOMENESS!
I had a fantastic falafel platter. Flavorful falafels, smooth, creamy hummus, delicious Tahini sauce, fresh veggies and pita bread. And DO order the mint iced tea. Yum.
My husband had the Gyro platter with lamb and beef. He loved it. We rarely rave about the same place but Baladie had us both talking about when to visit next.
Prices are very reasonable. The couple that owns the place are super nice. It is just the kind of Local place we love. GO.
I have been going here for a couple years and I love the gyros and the shwarma(spelling?) is really good. The owners do a great job with all their food. Enjoy!!!
Had the lamb gyro which was the best I ever had.  Definitely worth a visit.  I will revisit when back in town.

Hm, I'm not sure why this place has such great reviews. It was definitely just barely "meh." 
We called in our order for takeout and when we brought it home they had left out one of the gyros wraps. The meat itself was all dried out. They did say it was a very slow day, but still...the food should be fresh! They gave us some pitas to take home in a pita bag from the grocery store. Seriously?
The dipping sauce for the pitas WAS really great. 
Maybe it was an off day? I don't know. There are way too many other Greek options in Vegas for me to waste more $ here.

Great food and a very nice couple that runs the place like a family dining room.  We can't wait to go back.  Baladie Cafe is a great locally-owned spot for those of us on the north side of the valley...no need to drive to The Strip.

One of my favorite spots. Love the fries with herbs and the gyro is so yummy! Mojadara, rice with lentils is a treat. Friendly environment. It takes a bit for food to served but you can always call ahead. Love this place!

My husband and I love this place. We come here a couple times a month. Their gyros are delicious and the couple that runs the place are super nice! They really make the effort to make sure that everything is to your liking. It's like visiting a family member for a meal. :) I highly recommend coming here for a bite.
We had the best lentil soup I've tasted along with two shwarmas that were fresh and tasty.  The owners were very friendly, we will go back.
I love this little mom n pop greek place. Ive been co.ing herw at least 12 years now. Love the baklava and the gyros! BEC on a bagel on weekends

This place is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! The customer service alone is worth going for but THE FOOD THO!!! For real ,I love this place!!! Everything we have had from there has been out of this world!!!! I would highly suggest giving this place a try if your looking for something new and yummy !!!!
Great Mediterranean food, smoothies, breakfast bagels and homemade  hummus. Love coming here, they always treat people the right way.

This plce is great!  My husband found it by accident going to Ace Hardware one day.  We geek the beef & lamb gyro platter with french fries and I love it.  Its the best gyros we have had in North Las Vegas.  The only place that comes close is waaay in Henderson but the friendly customer service here is unmatched!

We had the pistachio baklava and the falafel and the Greek salad. The dressing on the salad was amazing. The greens were fresh. The baklava was not too sweet but flaky and yummy. The falafel was really amazing. Fresh and creamy.

Heaven on a plate. Wonderful owners and made from scratch. Moussaka is heavenly. Gyro meat is the best I've ever eaten. The Greek Sampler is $11 and I challenge you to find better homemade food for less. 

The baklava is perfectly made, too. It has jus the right amount of honey (real honey, too) to hold it together without turning into a giant mess like virtually every other place.

Baladie's is great.  The owner, from Algeria, is extremely friendly and welcoming.   The prices  are very reasonable, and the food pretty tasty.  This is a really great addition to the area that you should definitely check out.  I recommend the lamb and beef gyro wrap with feta cheese and fries.  I don't know what the seasoning is on the fries or in the dipping sauce, but dang those are tasty!

I have been going to Baladie's since shortly after I came to Las Vegas in 2004.  It has always been very good, fresh, homemade. Tonight I took 3 friends and they all loved it also.  There was an herb mixture in the pita triangles, which was new to me. Upon asking the owner what it was he said it was "just something she did".  She is his wife. We brought pistachio baklava home for desert.  Simply fabulous.
Loved it!  Loved the food, loved the people.  If you don't live in the area it's worth the drive to check out.  Gyros are amazing.

Ordered the beef and lamb gyro with seasoned fries. The fries were deliciously and there was a sauce that came with the food that was really tasty. The gyro was good but not amazing. It could have used more meat. 

The best part about this place was the host/cashier/waiter. He was really energetic and friendly and made sure we were taken care of. Excellent service.

I brought the BF for lunch...poor thing has been sick and needs some good,simple, healthy foods. 

We split:

A falafel wrap- yummy. Fresh falafel, cucumbers, onions, lettuce, hummus, chili sauce. The falafel is fresh made and not some box mix.

A Greek plate which has spanakopita, moussaka, gyro meat, tzatsiki, 2 dolmas, fetta cheese, half greek salad, pita bread. The spanakopita was wrapped individually in phyllo and not cut out of a casserole. I like theirs- it's not greasy like other places. The moussaka came as a surprise....most places it's so dry and taste like it sat around. This was saucy and had a nice balance of spices....I would actually order a whole portion here, which I have never done. I made little sandwiches with the gyro, pita, tomatoes and olive on the plate and tzatziki- all good. Dolmas here are great. 

I bought a box of baklava to take home. I like that they don't over pour honey on the layer of nuts since that usually makes it so hard to bite through. It's just right amounts of everything. Me loves. 

So glad I was able to come back...it's been a while since my first visit though I promised to be back! Better late than never, but the next visit should come sooner.

Well, 

After seeing this place on Yelp for 2 years, I finally made my way over. I always forget that there is another Greek place in the area, and I will never forget again.

This place is absolutely delectable. 
We had the -
Gyro wrap with the spicy sauce added
Herb Fries w/ some kind of herb dipping sauce that was so different but so yummy.
AND THE BAKLAVA. The baklava was so good, so light and crispy with a perfect amount of honey.
The ONLY thing I feel is lacking - I wish they would put a little more meat in the Gyros. The pita is thin, which I love. But there wasn't a flowing amount of meat, which is what most places do. So maybe I'll just order double meat next time.

We walked in for lunch, and the couple that owns the place quickly greeted us and were very friendly. It's just the perfect little ma and pop place tucked away in this little corner. 

I can't wait to come back here again and it will be my go to place for Greek food in the NW corner of Vegas. 

Come here and support the small businesses!!

Went there a few months ago.  I tired the falafel and the gyro.  Both were a-ok--nothing special or spectacular.  Food moderately priced.  The customer service was phenomenal though! You can tell that they have a real interest in their customers.  You can tell they take pride in making the food and making it to order.  I did like the hot sauce.  Super garlicy.
Great food and great people.  It's a place where the owners know you personally and treat you great.  Their food matches their service.

The hummus with the smoked paprika on top is absolutely delish. Little irritated how there was 2 falafel, 2 dolmas  and 5 olives on my to go plate. The rest of the plate was filled with shredded lettuce, cucumber, tomatoes and a pile of parsley. If they want people to come back they need to stop using veggies as a plate filler.

So Yummy! Really the best gyros with some spicy sauce they pour over the meat is divine! They also have some out of this world bagels with a to die for green sauce. My 18 month old son will even eat Anything on their menu! Now if that doesn't seal the deal I don't know what will! The owners are so lovely and sweet, but just enough. Sometimes I'll go to other places but they're overly nice and talk forever, not them. It's just perfection! Definitely pronounced a good day when my son and I go!

Tried the gyro, it wasn't bad but it wasn't special IMO.  It was a good price, about $5.50 I think, which may be why I was still a little hungry afterwards.  I guess a $8-9 gyro should have almost twice as much meat, but even taste vs taste, I probably wouldn't come here again for a gyro.

I did not try any other food there though, which I am sure would have been good.  Maybe one day I will be more brave and try new med food.

Another tiny complaint, we came in on a weekend around lunchtime 130-2pm, and we were the only people there, even after we were done with our food.  After we ordered, the owners or people working the front disappeared and I never saw them after they dropped off the food.  They didn't ask how the food was, and we didn't have the chance to say thank you, since they left and never came back out LOL
The husband and wife owners are wonderful people and every dish is great. I recommend the spicy lamb gyro and fries.

Really nice folks and tasty good food.  Be ready for the couple that run this place to start greeting you like family after a visit or two.  I love to drop in for some chicken kebabs with a good curry flavor.  All kinds of fantastic food cooked right there.

In a large plaza, it feels like a hidden gem in Las Vegas, but that can be relative considering that I am from California (population might've thrown my calibration off).

This place is delicious! The owner is so nice and he does his best to accomodate every customer. He usually just have one other worker with him, so he's running around and working extremely hard to make sure everyone's needs are met. I always give lots of respect to small restaurants like this. The food (schwerma, gyros, everything) is really good and very refreshing. The prices are decent. 

I have not had the lamb yet, so I can't comment whether it is gamy or not. But the chicken and beef are for sure delicious!

The decor is soo cute! It makes me feel like I'm in a small town of Greece. It's very casual too.

I used to eat at Baladie Cafe once or twice a week, for about a year.  
This was about 6-7 years ago. 

When I moved out of my parents house,  I stopped driving to North Vegas, because it was just WAY too much on my poor old car, may she rest in peace. lol

This weekend, I happened to be out visiting my parents, and decided on my way home that I wanted to have shawarma.  
My fella had never tried shawarma before, and so I was thrilled to take him to a place that I used to love so much.  

We walked in, and were greeted warmly.

The interior is a little more worn than I remember, and they were playing the same radio station that I had on in the car, instead of the old Mediterranean music I remember hearing on my old visits, but it felt the same to me:   welcoming and inviting.

We looked at the menu, although I already knew what I wanted:  
1 piece of Spanikopita, and the chicken shawarma wrap. 

My fella ordered the lamb/beef shawarma wrap with feta and fries, and a couple pieces of falafel.  

The wraps are HUGE!  They are bigger than I remembered them being, and every bit as delicious!  The chicken was moist and tender, with delicious hummus, and tahini.  I ordered mine medium spicy (which I never used to do, NO spice! Ever!  I'm glad my tastes have evolved.) and absolutely devoured it. 

The lamb/beef one is gyro meat, which my fella was mildly disappointed in, thinking it was actually pieces of lamb, but he still enjoyed it.  I am a HUGE fan of gyro meat, so the next time I go, I'm getting that one. ;)  

The spanikopita was delicious and flavorful, served with a large helping of tzatziki.  

The fries were good too, but I really loved the falafel!  For me, I'm used to falafel being super brown, almost burnt on the sides, and very greasy.  
These were not.  They were a golden brown, flavorful, and not greasy at all, which makes me wonder if they were baked?  However they were prepared, they were awesome. 

The owners are as nice as can be, and after I went to ask him about one of the sauces, we got to talking, and he said that I looked familiar.  
I haven't been in their place in 6-7 years, and he remembered me...even if it was vaguely, that still impresses me.  She was super nice and constantly checked up on us, making sure that we, and the other patrons, enjoyed everything. 

I really wish that they were closer to my side of town, but perhaps I can make it a monthly outing with my family...great job guys!

What a super sweet, welcoming place! The owner was immensely friendly and helpful. He even opened up my Snapple for me because I had my hands full of baby + copious amounts of baby swag. So nice!
The shawarma plate was very good, with fresh onions, cucumber, lettuce and tomato. I appreciated the spicy sauce being placed on the side so that I could experiment with different intensities (the sauce on the side was the owner's idea when I let him know I planned to share the meal with my baby). The pita might have been fresher and the hummus didn't totally knock my socks off, but the garnish of fresh garlic, cucumber and I-would-love-to-know-what-else on the hummus was delish. The breakfast menu piqued my interest and I'm looking forward to trying the salmon with lox on another visit... 
Excellent customer service was what really left an impression at Baladie Café and it will definitely keep me coming back!
I had been craving a gyro for weeks and this place made it worth the wait! The owners were very nice and attentive and made wonderful suggestions.
I tried Greek food here for the first time. I had a regular Gyro which was very good. I especially loved the pistachio Baklava and will go back just for it.

Two things. 1) Baladie Cafe has the best fries ever and; 2) the husband and wife duo that manage this local gem are some of the most friendly people you'll ever meet.

I have loved Baladie's ever since I first ate there. A friend recommended this quaint eatery to us as the closest thing we could get to a German Doner Kabob in Las Vegas. After eating at Baladie's, my husband can confirm this to be true! What I love about Baladie's is that the food is incredibly consistent and more importantly, delicious! The owners are from Algeria and just radiate warmth. The wife cooks up the meals and the husband entertainingly takes orders. On almost every visit, I've witnessed the owners chatting it up with customers like old friends. Sometimes they give out hugs too! 

I get the gyro without any meat ($5.50) and a side of herb fries ($1.60). The gyro wrap is smallish in size but makes up for that in flavor. It's actually the perfect amount of food. I don't usually get excited about the cucumbers or tomatoes in gyros, but I do when I'm at Baladie's. Don't even get me started on those fries. I have to hold myself back from ordering two orders of the herb fries. 

The cafe is intimate and located in a pretty desolate shopping center on Lone Mountain and Decatur. The drinks are self-serve. Customers scoop up their own utensils and napkins, but the owners will always check up on you and ask if you enjoyed your meal. 

Worth a Return Visit?
I cannot recommend Baladie Cafe enough, people! It's one of the best places to eat at in North Las Vegas.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #75

What a wonderful little hole-in-the-wall restaurant in the Northwest corner of Las Vegas! As many other Yelpers have posted, I've seen this place rated consistently great for a long time and figured I'd give it a go. So glad I did! 

The proprietors were incredibly friendly, and my food was absolutely fantastic. 

I ordered the falafel plate and dolmathes (stuffed grape leaves). Fresh, tasty and cooked to perfection. 

The restaurant is clean and inviting with a few tables if you care to eat in. I chose to take out, and if I waited 5 minutes for my order I'm overstating. Just wonderful, I can't wait to go back and try more items from the menu...next? Gyros. Yup.
Placed an order and was told the food would be done in "20 minutes". It was more like 45/1 hr. The food was so-so.  The customer service was good and the baklava was excellent.

I had the greek salad and my boyfriend had the gyro. His fries were really good and the salad was super refreshing and filling with the herb pita. It was my first time there so I'll definitely be going back.

The staff was very pleasant. Walked in and asked for what is popular and help finding something that would please my taste buds. The gentleman behind the counter helped my girlfriend and I out. We were looking at the pictures on yelp and decided to get baklava for dessert after we finished our chicken shawerma w/feta and lamb and beef gyro w/feta wraps.  We were pleasantly filled and got the pistachio baklava to go.  
The entire meal was super tasty and filling!!! 
You must check this place out, customer service and great food are awaiting your visit.

The original Greek owners of this restaurant have sold it and moved to California. This is very very unfortunate as it seems the new staff has no personality and even less talent in the kitchen. They've also raised prices. We have eaten at this place probably 30 times over the last 2 years, and unfortunately probably never again. It's too bad too, because this was one of the best Greek restaurants in the city.

The food is really good. This is a family run business and both times I have been here a husband and wife are working. It seems that the husband takes care of the business side while the wife prepares the dishes served. The food is authentic and all homemade. I will have to say that some of the prices are abit steep for what you get. A side of olives for example is 3.50 and that gets you about 8 olives. Also the portion of a side salad is the same price and you should get a bit more as lettuce and greens have a low cost ratio. Give this local place a try and help out the small business in your neighborhood.

I came to this place because of the ratings 
And it doesn't add up, place is hot, service was slow 25 min waiting for my food, expensive for the amount and quality.
Sorry but thats my experience

I was eating lunch here on a consistent basis for a few months until I moved. After a substantial hiatus, I decided to pay this old friend a visit. Upon entering the cafe, the owner immediatly recognized me and said, "I have something for you!" and ran into the back to fetch a sweater I had left here FOUR MONTHS EARLIER! Sure, it stunk like it had been deep fried, but I was pretty amazed that they a) remembered me, b) held onto an article of my clothing for so long. But I digress- the food here is fresh and consistently tasty, and (obviously) the couple that own and run the place are super friendly. They cook up the best falafel I've had in Vegas, these aren't the usual crusty balls of powdered chickpea and celery salt deep fried until they're but a memory of vegetable many understand to be falafel. They are fresh, bright green balls with bits of parsley and cilantro clearly visible when you bite into them. They also serve great Greek fries, shawarma that is neither dry nor greasy, and good homemade lentil stew. Ample indoor seating, limited outdoor seating. Pet friendly!

Don't eat at this place. The gyro came wrapped in a cold cardboard like pita bread. I will say the owners wife was very nice but the owner him self being on his lap top was very off putting. Felt like we were bothering him. I had some fries as well let's say all 10 fries were tasty I'm guessing they were having a potato shortage with just a hand full of fries. This place had a very dirty beverage fridge in the public area. Just not a well put together cafe with very poor food.

I am now a fan of Baladie cafe. I am a big Gyro fan. the Lamb-Beef gyro here was the best i have enjoyed in Las Vegas. If you are a Greek-Mediterranean food fan. i strongly advise a visit. As stated the food was great. service was a little slow,but the friendliness more than made up for the wait.

Had I yelped years ago perhaps I would've inputted a review sooner. But it has literally been about 4 years since we first and last came here.

Why first and last? While it is great that we have a Mediterranean establishment nearby...I have also been spoiled by another Mediterranean that is across town when it comes to quality.

We came in because at the time the Baskin Robbins near it was the nearest Baskin Robbins from our home.  Husband and I were excited to find a spot close to home and for cheap (considering how much we pay for a gyro at our fave greek spot). I ordered the chicken gyro (6.99) with feta cheese. Which at the time I believe was an extra charge of 50 or 75cents? Dont recall.While it wasn't lousy, it also wasn't meeting my expectations. The tzatiki sauce was rather bland and even the feta cheese tasted flat. Love me some feta! The pita itself was pretty good, though. 

I do remember their fries being pretty good. Think what else turned me off from coming back was not only the gyro just alright to me...we ordered a kids chicken nugget meal for my then almost 2 year old and was disappointed that we got served the Mickey mouse nuggets you find from costco. It was disappointing because we had a bag of it sitting in our freezer at that time! I would buy it because I would cook that for lunch for my then 2 boys a few times a week. 

I remember walking out feeling disappointed and still hungry to be frank. I do want to go back again to give them another shot. Maybe twas a bad day for my taste buds? Taste buds under weather? Taste buds gone fishinh? I don't know. Whatever it is though I walked out bummed as I was really hoping for something deeelish!

However, I would recommend this place if you're nearby. I really wouldn't suggest to anyone to make journey here if it is out of one's way.

This is a gem. We are regulars for shwarmas. But its the fries...oh heavenly fries with the best dipping sauce ever. Seasoned with herbs. Oh man. 
Homemade baklava
..in walnut or (oh joy and rapture) pistachios.  I thought that was heaven til I tried the rice pudding. So Fab. 
We also love the Greek salad. 
The couple who runs this place have true mom n pop personality. They run it themselves and start at six am. Good people. 

This is a place to go. Don't walk...run there!

Nice and clean environment.  Food smells yummy and the staff were very patient and helpful with all my questions in helping me make my decision on what to order.  My second time here, it's been awhile since the first time but I remember their food was delicious.  Oh and not too pricey either!
It was our first time eating Greek food. We loved it. It's great food. The owner provided us an incredible, personalized service. We can't wait to come back.

On point! Out of the way for me but I was in the area and stopped by and was pleasantly surprised! The spicy beef and lamb gyro was perfect! And he talked me into herbed fries which came with a dipping sauce that was pretty good. Full and satisfied :) would recommend!
This was our first time, we were very impressed w gyro. We had many of these in Europe, these were the best we have had since. We will be back for sure.

This is what YELP is for and the Baladie cafe is for Yelpers!  I can really appreciate a small privately owned place.  I appreciate a place where the owners appreciate my business. 

It is a small place in a Vons plaza - but the Vons is closed.  I have been by here a million times but never even thought about going in here for lunch. 

It is a tiny place with 5 or 6 tables.  They have mediterranean food and greek food.  I had the Gyro plate with some fries.  The fries were seasoned and served with a flavorful dipping sauce.  The Gyro plate had all the fixins for a gyro but it was unassembled.  I liked putting it together.   All the ingredients were fresh and flavorful.

This place offers a great value.  The food is quality eats... something you would expect in a finer establishment with higher prices.  So for a quick serve place and quick serve prices - you get great food, real plates, and great service!

Since I live in the general area it was refreshing to find a mom and pop joint mixed in with all of the chain restaurants.

(I have been staring at my computer debating whether I should do 4 or 5 stars...)

Some of the best Mediterranean food out here. My bf and I have been looking for healthier options when going out to eat and the food here fits that description perfectly. Everything tasted fresh. Nothing greasy or stale about it. We can't wait to go back. The owners were really nice too! Anyone looking to try a new place should definitely stop by.

Heard about this place from a friend and man was he right, awesome food! The moment we walked in the door we were welcomed by the owner we assume. He waited patiently while we read over the menu and made or decisions.  Then asked if my husband wanted his spicy he said yes, and I ordered and he asked same of me. I said no, and the friendly jokes started...in the end we were all laughing and made us feel very welcome in this small cafe.  
The food came out in great time.  Enough time to know it was made fresh, but not a long wait.  Hubby got a lam and beef shawarma and I had a chicken gyro and order of the amazing spiced fries.  Great flavor, soft wraps and the size/amount of ingredients was spot on.  I normally don't care for tziki sauce as I find it overpowering, but I'm very glad I didn't ask them to remove it it was delish! Next time I'll go ahead on the spice as it was warm but not hot.  Can't wait to go back :-)

Amazing food. It is a small place so don't expect anything grand. Food made to order and it does take some time for your food to come out. So if you are in a rush for quick lunch I would not recommend. But if you want great food and have some time to wait, I highly recommend this place. I've never been disappointed, unlike some other reviews.
Great food, nice people. Family owned business. Been there many times and will keep going back.

Mid morning, searching for a place that was open...not really sure what I was in the mood for.  Conducted a simple query of open restaurants in the area.  Scrolled through the Mickey D's, the Carls Jr's, and the like.  Stumbled upon Baladie Cafe.  Reviews were superb, the name had Cafe in it and it just felt right.

Tucked away in the corner of a business plaza, I located the Cafe.  Walked in open minded ready for anything.  Sweet lady behind the counter said that the beef and lamb gyro was probably the most popular.  I went with it.

Said all that to say this...the 'yee-ro' was delicious.  I had a paper menu I was reviewing while I consumed it and was already planning my next immediate order.  I was leaning hard and heavy towards The Hudson (Bagel sandwich with Nova Smoked Salmon, Cream Cheese, Tomato, Cucumber, Red Onion and Caper).  But the more I ate of the Gyro, I was thinking of going for seconds...then at some point while I was eating I chuckled and felt my fat jiggle, felt like a fatty and ordered the Greek Salad to go! ;)

Giv'er a go!

ps. Got The Hudson to go to...

This review is based on the falafel sandwich. I'm a big champion of small but authentic holes in the wall, but based on the falafel, this is not one of them. Chickpeas were not crunchy or well spiced. The sauce was unrecognizable. Lack of veggies. There are much better falafels in town.

Never knew that this gem of a yummy place existed near my neighborhood.   My daughter and I enjoyed a delicious lunch that clearly was made with love and passion for fresh, authentic food.

My daughter had the falafel wrap and I had the chicken gyro.  I also had a side of falafel, which was delicious.  We finished our scrumptious lunch with pistachio and walnut baklava.  

The owners are super sweet and welcoming.  My daughter and I enjoyed interacting and joking around with them.  Reasonably priced awesome food and great customer service is why I will now recommend this place to others and will visit more often.

Brought my family here for the first time. We ordered #2 with (3) Gyro meat and (1) chicken. An order of seasoned fries and bakhlava (pistachio and walnut).

Food was excellent!! Bakhlava (pistachio) was my favorite. The food was presented great compared to other Meditteranean restaurants. Usually, it would be served with all food mixed together. Not here, food is separated to make the dish how you want! (Perfect idea!). Great sauces and seasoned fries! Gyro meat was WONDERFUL! Owners and staff were so nice and helpful with ordering and answering questions!

Only downfall is no public restroom. 
Will be bringing my parents here next time they visit!

My buddy who lives local took me to this place.  The food is really good.  The inside is old school. It's a cafe and you order at the counter.  There isn't anything fancy inside.  Water & utensils are self-serving.

Lamb & beef Gyro-Wrap ($8)  - 4.5/5
I couldn't get enough of this dish; the lamb & beef gyro was delicious.  I opted to get it spicy.  They add spicy sauce used in Thai red-sauce spices (think Sriacha w/ more spices).  As such, it tastes like an Asian infusion Greek gyro.  The dipping sauce w/ the fries is also delicious; it tasted like a Greek thousand islands.  I didn't even use any of the ketchup I just used the Greek dipping sauce.  It was THAT good! =)

TIPS:
-Located in the same plaza as the Sears Outlet
Great food and a friendly atmosphere. Reasonable prices. Just wish the sign out front was working so that more people knew about it! Found it on Yelp and very glad I did. Coming back soon.

Moved to the other side of town and was missing my gyro spot, The Fat Greek and decided to give this one a try. Ordered a lamb and beef gyro per the suggestion of the cashier/cook with a side of rice. Pita bread was a bit dry, as was the meat. The veggies could have been much fresher.. along with the tzatziki more authentic. Maybe im a bit spoiled from The Fat Greek being what I now know as.. THE best spot in town. Baladie has real silverware and not the cheap kind! Very friendly staff! Huge fans.. which bugs me because they blow so much air it cools the food off before I have a chance to eat. Giving this place 3 stars.. basically just for the staff. I understand they've changed owners and maybe its starting to show.
I have eaten at this cafe several times and as always staff are very friendly the food is absolutelty AMAZING!!!

Great place to explore new food! So good, I have gone back several times before I could get this written!  The Tabulli salad is good!!!! Gyros are pretty good!  Baklava will have you in heaven in no time.  Go! Enjoy!!!!!
It's a little mom n pops place.. Salads, bagels, Esspreso, pita wraps and more! Great food and even better atmosphere! Oh yeah get the fries!

Bad experience. My co-workers and I went there for our lunch hour and spent the whole hour just waiting for our food. The service was sloooooow. The taste of the food was ok, but not worth the wait. The place was not clean. The counter tops had dirty prints. The cashier said she was new and did not know much. When we asked her something, she was rude. They don't have a restroom for the clients so there is no where to wash your hands. The owner blamed all their mistakes on the place being under new management and new staff. Why would you put new employees on the floor without training? Like hello! We wanted to ask for a refund, but we felt sorry for them.
Great service. Fun mom and pop shop atmosphere. Best gyro I've had! This will be a regular restaurant for our family now.
After writing my review I was contacted by the owner   He wanted to know what he could do to make it right. I was very touched that he took the time to contact me.

I've been a repeat customer for many years.  Unfortunately the portion size and quality of the food are not as good as they use to be.  I know this small cafe struggled during the recession and pulled through.  However now it seems like they're calling it in.  We ordered fries and you could count the number of fries on two hands.  If I would have been served this meal 5 years ago I would not have gone back.

I came here based on the Yelp reviews but ended up disappointed. I ordered the chicken shawarma wrap and there was more lettuce and filling then there was meat and the taste was lacking. 

Unfortunately I will not be returning
Great small little nook.  You have to build your own gyro, I didn't know that getting it to go.  Great tasting meat.  Very small seating area.
Crazy yummy, pretty veggie friendly, and the owners are two of the nicest people you'll meet!  I have yet to have anything here that I didn't love.  Highly recommend the falafel platter.

Absolutely delicious! Great vegetarian options! The lentil soup is so yummy & spicy & the falafels are cooked perfectly. Been here a few times now, always good & super friendly service. Great local spot!!!!

Love this place. It's probably what you would call a hole in the wall, but aren't those places usually the best? Both owners, wonderful people, always remember you, always smile and always go out of their way to accommodate you. You want to swap sides? No problem. I always eat lamb strips over Basati rice with lentils and roasted onions. I swap the cucumber sauce with a homemade red sauce with lots of garlic and sauteed onions.... Too big to eat and I take it home for only $6. I top it off with homemade tapioca pudding, topped with cinnamon and Pistachios. Sometimes I go in for a morning bagel. They recently switched to a different bakery and man..... those bagels are phenomenal. You can get them plain, cream cheese, different kind of egg sandwiches or some unusual ones such as the Hudson, which is Salmon, Cream Cheese, Capers and Cucumbers. Such a treat. Hope they will be around for a while since the economy is tough and lots of places around them don't make it. Location is good, NW corner of Lone Mountain and Decatur, right across from Vons. Go there and see for yourself that the smallest places usually come with the biggest surprises.
Stopped in by chance one day, owner was awesome! I got the lamb gyro and wasn't disappointed. If you're in the mood for Mediterranean or Greek food this is the place for you!

I eat tons of Middle Eastern/Greek/Lebanese/Armenian food and know all the restaurants in town but hadn't tried this one.   I went to try it because the reviews were so good.  I can't understand how people can rate this even average. I don't like writing bad reviews but the food wasn't even worthy of trying once.  Salad dressing tasted store bought and was super sweet sugary balsamic which I don't like at all but more importantly wasn't authentic at all.  Hummus was bland. Middle Eastern food is supposed to make you go WOW with spicy garlic, exotic spices, and awesome flavor.  You just don't get that here.  Not only was the food flavor not worthy the amount of food you are served is a joke.  Yes prices were cheap but you don't get any value.  Restaurant also has terrible ambiance, no pride of ownership, etc. which isn't that important to me if the food is good.  This place has nothing going for it other than the owners seemed like nice people with poor service and even worse food.
I love this place! The guy is always so friendly and the food is amazing. Easily one of the best gyros in town.
